colminiana: <entryFree id="n9133" type="main" key="Colminiana"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Colminiana</orth> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 1</bibl>), <orth extent="full" lang="la">Col-minia</orth> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24, 1</bibl>), <orth extent="full" lang="la">Culminia</orth> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:8:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:51:3" default="NO">12, 51, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:54:1" default="NO">12, 54, 1</bibl>), <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cominia</orth> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 18, 4</bibl>): olea, <sense id="n9133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown kind of olive-tree</hi> (concerning the varying readings, v. Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
colo: <entryFree id="n9134" type="main" key="co^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlo</orth>, <itype>colŭi, cultum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>from the stem <foreign lang="greek">*k*o*l</foreign>, whence <foreign lang="greek">bouko/los, boukole/w</foreign>; cf.: colonus, in-cola, agri-cola</etym> (orig. pertaining to agriculture), <sense id="n9134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cultivate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">till</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi> <cb n="COLO" /> <hi rend="ital">care of a field</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garden</hi>, etc. (freq. in all per. and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n9134.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9134.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">agri non omnes frugiferi sunt qui coluntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva et vineta et oleas et arbustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 17, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:21" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 413</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:624 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 624 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">patrios fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:14:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 13, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:687" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 687</bibl></cit>; cf. under <pos>P. a.</pos>—</sense><sense id="n9134.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:54:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 54, § 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9134.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., without reference to economics, <hi rend="ital">to abide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay in a place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inhabit</hi> (syn.: incolo, habito; most freq. since the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n9134.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemora atque cavos montes silvasque colebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:955" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 955</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regiones Acherunticas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colitur ea pars (urbis) et habitatur frequentissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem, urbem, mi Rufe, cole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 66, 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca Idae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36:12 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 12 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:17" default="NO" valid="yes">61, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem Trojanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sicaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeoniam Sipylumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Elin Messeniaque arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:679" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum nemorale Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:331" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:545" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Elysium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 735</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca magna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 681</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britanniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rheni ripam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victam ripam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of poets: <cit><quote lang="la">me juvat in primā coluisse Helicona juventā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to have written poetry in early youth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 5, 19.—Also of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis stagna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 430</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 380</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9134.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subdiu colere te usque perpetuom diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:67:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 67, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:9:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colunt discreti ac diversi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximi Cattis Usipii ac Tencteri colunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa utramque ripam Rhodani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā Cilices maritimi colunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 18, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope Oceanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:49:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 49, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad Albim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra Borysthenem fluvium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super Bosporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra urbem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9134.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n9134.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bestow care upon a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to care for.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9134.9" n="1" level="3"> Of the gods: colere aliquem locum, <hi rend="ital">to frequent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cherish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">care for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be the guardian of</hi>, said of places where they were worshipped, had temples, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">deos deasque veneror, qui hanc urbem colunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 36, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas, quas condidit arces, Ipsa colat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (Juppiter) colit terras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 16</bibl> Forbig. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">undis jura dabat, nymphisque colentibus undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem colentes di,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 30, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 21, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, Ceres mater ac Proserpina, precor, ceteri superi infernique di, qui hanc urbem colitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 39, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divi divaeque, qui maria terrasque colitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 27, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9134.10" n="2" level="3"> Rarely with persons as object (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">curo, studeo, observo, obsequor): Juppiter, qui genus colis alisque hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Castor et Pollux) dum terras hominumque colunt genus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>improve</tr>, <tr>polish</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9134.11" n="3" level="3"> Of the body or its parts, <hi rend="ital">to cultivate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">formamque augere colendo,</quote> <trans><tr>by attire</tr>, <tr>dress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu quoque dum coleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:225" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 225</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacertos auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacertum armillā aureā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:39" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:9" default="NO">1, 8, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9134.12" n="4" level="3"> With abstr. objects, <hi rend="ital">to cultivate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cherish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devote one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to</hi>, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">of mental and moral cultivation: aequom et bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem rectumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:3:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus et fas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonos mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum quaestum colit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 41, 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam, justitiam, liberalitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginitatis amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 584</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 297</bibl></cit>; cf. Martem, Sil. <pb n="370" /> <cb n="COLO" /> 8, 464: <cit><quote lang="la">studium philosophiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:315" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequabile et temperatum orationis genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrias artes militiamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:508" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 508</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">artes liberales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium singulari rerum militarium prudentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:29:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 29, 5</bibl></cit> Kritz.—</sense><sense id="n9134.13" n="5" level="3"> Of a period of time or a condition, <hi rend="ital">to live in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">live through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutem apud aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to be a slave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc plane nec ego victum, nec vitam illam colere possum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 28, 2</bibl></cit>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> in gen.: vitam or aevum = degere, <hi rend="ital">to take care of life</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">to live</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam inopem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevum vi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1144</bibl></cit> and 1149.—</sense><sense id="n9134.14" n="B" level="2"> Colere aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to regard one with care</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worship</hi>, etc. (syn.: observo, veneror, diligo). </sense><sense id="n9134.15" n="1" level="3"> Most freq. of the reverence and worship of the gods, and the respect paid to objects pertaining thereto, <hi rend="ital">to honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est enim cur deos ab hominibus colendos dicas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:41:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 41, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos deos et venerari et colere debemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebe silvarumque potens Diana... o colendi Semper et culti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:2" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 2</bibl></cit> and 3; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 350</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos aris, pulvinaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:11:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mercurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinem nimiā religione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cererem secubitu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> A. 3, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(deam) magis officiis quam probitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per flamines et sacerdotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo cognomine is deus quādam in parte urbis colebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 580" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 580</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimoniorum religionem et fidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 10, 21</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">colebantur religiones pie magis quam magnifice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57, 7</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quos juxta divinas religiones humana fides colitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 679</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:733" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 733</bibl></cit>; 6, 208; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">numina alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 458</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:578" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 578</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caerimonias sepulcrorum tantā curà,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrarium summā caerimoniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Th. 8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Th. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9134.16" n="2" level="3"> Of the honor bestowed upon men: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Africanum ut deum coleret Laelius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia me colitis et magnificatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus diligenter observari videmur et coli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 34, 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 41, 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtarum nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 22, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicis et diligendis et colendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 85</bibl></cit> and 82: <cit><quote lang="la">semper ego plebem Romanam militiae domique... colo atque colui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colere et ornare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me diligentissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 25</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te colo, Sexte, non amabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:55" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem donis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:43:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 43, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec illos arte colam, nec opulenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 34</bibl></cit> Kritz.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n9134.17" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">honoring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treating respectfully; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a reverer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worshipper;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 33, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9134.18" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I.). </sense><sense id="n9134.19" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Cultivated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tilled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager cultior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager cultissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia et culta et silvestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res pecuaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus cultissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus cultior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultiora loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9134.20" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">culta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">tilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivated land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gardens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plantations</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:210" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 210</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1370" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1370</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 153</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 196</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 372</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 10, 49, § 83</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9134.21" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">ornamented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites habebat tam cultos ut argento et auro politis armis ornaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:499" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 499</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba muliebriter culta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdos veste candidā cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 95, § 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrona vetitā purpurā culta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia cultior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:98:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 98, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi culti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora et ingenia cultiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tibullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultiores doctioresque redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermone cultissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 45" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 45</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cul-tē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">elegantly</hi>: dicere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 20, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 21</bibl>: (sc. veste) progredi, Just. <cb n="COLO" /> 3, 3, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">incubare strato lectulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> apparently not in use.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9135" type="main" key="co_lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>colum</etym>, <sense id="n9135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to filter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clarify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purify</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ceram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:16:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:11:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum sportā palmeā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucum linteo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 103, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thymum cribro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid per linteum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 271" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad colum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 28, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per colum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 343, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra colans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 23, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faex colata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 8, 44, § 95</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes inductis retibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to spread out a fish-net</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 193</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">cleansed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purified</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nitor (beryllorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9135.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">certiora et colatiora somniari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colobathrarius: <entryFree id="n9136" type="main" key="co_lo^bathra_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlŏbathrārius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">kwlo/baqron</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n9136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who walks on stilts</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 115, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colobicus: <entryFree id="n9137" type="greek" key="co^lo^bi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlŏbĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kolobiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n9137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mutilated</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 14, 8.</sense></entryFree>
colobium: <entryFree id="n9138" type="greek" key="co^lo^bi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlŏbĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlŏbum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, Cod. Th. 14, 10, 1), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kolo/bion</foreign>, <sense id="n9138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an undergarment with short sleeves</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 616</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colobos: <entryFree id="n9139" type="greek" key="co^lo^bo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlŏbŏs</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kolobo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n9139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mutilated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curtailed</hi>, only in metre: versus, <hi rend="ital">in which one syllable is wanting</hi>, = catalectus, Mall. Theod. Metr. 7: <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>; Marc. Vict. p. 2504 P.</sense></entryFree>
colocasia: <entryFree id="n9140" type="greek" key="co^lo^ca_si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlŏcāsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlŏcāsĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 33, 13</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">kolokasi/a</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">koloka/sion</foreign>, <sense id="n9140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Egyptian bean;</hi> a magnificent plant of the lily kind, growing in the lakes and marshes of Egypt, whose beans, roots, and even the stalks and stems, were considered as luxuries, and from its large leaves drinking-cups (ciboria) were made, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 51, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apr. 3, 5</bibl>; cf. Voss ad Verg. l. l. (The colocasia of Virgil is supposed to be the Arum colocasia of Linnæus. Pliny appears to confound this with the Nymphaea lotos of Linn.)</sense></entryFree>
colocasitis: <entryFree id="n9141" type="main" key="Co^lo^ca_si_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏlŏcāsītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kolokasi=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n9141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island near the coast of Africa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colocynthis: <entryFree id="n9142" type="main" key="co^lo^cynthis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlŏcynthis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kolokunqi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n9142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the colocynth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coloquintida</hi>, used as a purgative: Cucumis colocynthis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colon: <entryFree id="n9143" type="main" key="co_lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 31, 1</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">kw=lon</foreign> (a member). <sense id="n9143.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The colon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">great gut</hi> (the largest of the intestines), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 79, § 202</bibl>.—Esp., as the part affected by the colic: <cit><quote lang="la">coli tormentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 37, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coli dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 122" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 122</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9143.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A disease of the colon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the colic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 15, 57, § 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:102" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 9, 45, § 102</bibl>; Scrib. Comp. l. l.; Ser. Samm. l. l.—</sense><sense id="n9143.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a member of a verse</hi> (pure Lat. membrum), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 78</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of a poem</hi>, Aug. ap. Don. Vit. Verg. c. 12.</sense></entryFree>
colona: <entryFree id="n9144" type="main" key="co^lo_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>colonus</etym>, <sense id="n9144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a countrywoman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:692" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 692</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 646</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:54" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4644</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colonae: <entryFree id="n9145" type="main" key="Co^lo_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏlōnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kolwnai/</foreign>. <sense id="n9145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Troas</hi>, now prob. <hi rend="ital">Chemali</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 3</bibl>; the same called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏlōnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colonarius: <entryFree id="n9146" type="main" key="co^lo_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>colonia</etym>, <sense id="n9146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the</hi> colonus, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">persona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 4, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colonatus: <entryFree id="n9147" type="main" key="co^lo_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlōnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>colonus</etym>, <sense id="n9147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the condition of a rustic</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 12, 1, 33; 14, 18, 1.</sense></entryFree>
coloneus: <entryFree id="n9148" type="main" key="Co^lo_ne_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏlōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kolw/neios</foreign>, <sense id="n9148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Attic</hi> demos Colonos (<foreign lang="greek">*kolwno/s</foreign>): Oedipus (<foreign lang="greek">*oi)di/pous e)pi\ *kolwnw=|</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 22</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Coloneus,</quote> <trans><tr>the tragedy of Sophocles</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 298, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colonia: <entryFree id="n9149" type="main" key="co^lo_ni^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>colonus</etym>. <sense id="n9149.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to colonus, I.) <hi rend="ital">A possession in land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a landed estate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a farm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:24:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 24, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:20" default="NO">33, 7, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9149.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An abode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwelling</hi> in gen. (cf. 1. colo, I. B.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 40</bibl>; and humorously: molarum, for <hi rend="ital">a mill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 38</bibl>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n9149.2" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to colonus, II.) <hi rend="ital">A colony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colonial town</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settlement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia dicta est a colendo: est autem pars civium aut sociorum, missa ubi rem publicam habeant ex consensu suae civitatis aut publico ejus populi unde profecti sunt consilio. Hae autem coloniae sunt. quae ex consensu publico, non ex secessione sunt conditae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="COLO" /> 12: <cit><quote lang="la">in coloniam aliquos emittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:29" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in colonias mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:49:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 49, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloniam collocare idoneis in locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:27:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 27, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—Also freq., </sense><sense id="n9149.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">the persons sent for the establishment of such a town</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colonists</hi>, <hi rend="ital">planters;</hi> hence: <cit><quote lang="la">coloniam deducere aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteranorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:39:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 39, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 40, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 27, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 34, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 20, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 28, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 46, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 1, 1</bibl>; 39, 55, 5 (<hi rend="ital">bis</hi>) and 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:9 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 9 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere in Aeoliam, Ioniam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. on the Roman colonies, their laws and regulations, Nieb. Röm. Gesch. 2, p. 49 sq.; Madv. Opusc. Ac. p. 208 sq.; and Dict. of Antiq. —</sense><sense id="n9149.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">colonies of bees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 9</bibl> and 29.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9150" type="main" key="Co^lo_ni^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏlōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n9150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name given to several colonial</hi> or <hi rend="ital">provincial cities</hi>, but always, in the class. lang., with a more definite appellation; as Colonia Agrippina or Agrippinensis, the present <hi rend="ital">Cologne.</hi></sense></entryFree>
coloniarius: <entryFree id="n9151" type="main" key="co^lo_ni^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlōnĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>colonia, II.</etym>, <sense id="n9151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">native of a colony</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, § 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, § 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Sent. 19, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colonicus: <entryFree id="n9152" type="main" key="co^lo_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlōnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>colonus, I.</etym>. <sense id="n9152.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to agriculture</hi> or <hi rend="ital">husbandry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus ovium,</quote> <trans><tr>found upon any farm</tr>, <tr>common</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 47, 72, § 189</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:96" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 10, 62, § 96</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9152.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-lōnĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a farm-house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rustic</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s hut</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9152.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to a colony</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <trans><tr>levied from colonies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decuriones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colonus: <entryFree id="n9153" type="main" key="co^lo_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlōnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>colo</etym>. <sense id="n9153.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A husbandman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tiller of the soil</hi> (opp. pastor), Cato, R. R. prooem. § 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl>, prooem. § 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 21</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 287</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 14, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9153.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a farmer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one who cultivates another</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s land</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:32:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 32, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 8</bibl> (24), 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:15 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 15 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n9153.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A colonist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitant of a colonial town</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/poikos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:28:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 28, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:40:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 40, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:11:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 11, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 26, 3</bibl> and 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 12 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9153.3" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 410</bibl>.—Humorously: <cit><quote lang="la">catenarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colophon: <entryFree id="n9154" type="main" key="Co^lo^phon1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏlŏphon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> -nem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl>; <sense id="n9154.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">-na,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 54</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kolofw/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">one of the twelve Ionian towns in Lydia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situated near the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and renowned for its cavalry</hi>, now perh. <hi rend="ital">Zille</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Altobosco</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:26:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 26, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9154.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n9154.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏlŏphōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Colophonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">resina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 123</bibl></cit> (also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Colophonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 137 sq" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 137 sq.</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">Idmon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏlŏphōnii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Colophonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 8, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9154.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏlŏphōnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: Homerus (since the inhabitants of Colophon considered him as their countryman; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Cic. Arch. l. l.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 19, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 19, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9155" type="gloss" key="co^lo^pho_n2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlŏphōn</orth>, <itype>ōnos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: colophon dixerunt, cum aliquid finitum significaretur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=37:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 37, 14</bibl> Müll. [ = <foreign lang="greek">kolofw/n</foreign>, the summit, the top; cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kolofw=na e)piqei=nai</foreign>, v. Lidd. and Scott, s. v. <foreign lang="greek">kolofw/n</foreign>].</entryFree>
color: <entryFree id="n9156" type="main" key="co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlor</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlos</orth>, <itype>like arbos, clamos, honos</itype>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 208</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1073" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1073</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 5</bibl>, acc. to Prob. II. pp. 1456 and 1467 P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 30, § 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:150" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 11, 42, § 150</bibl>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root cal-, to cover; cf.: caligo, occulere, calyx</etym>, <sense id="n9156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tint.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9156.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9156.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">varii rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:786" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 786</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequeunt sine luce Esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:795" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 795</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aureus ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">albus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 823</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">color albus praecipue decorus deo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpureus conchyli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1073" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1073</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrios mirare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 165</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 261</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 452</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colorem accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 38, 91, § 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inducere picturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color caerulo albidior, viridior et pressior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amethystinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color in pomo est, ubi permaturuit, ater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 165</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 2, 6, § 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 6, 5, § 41</bibl></cit>: colores, oculos qui pascere possunt, <pb n="371" /> <cb n="COLO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 419</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus nox abstulit atra colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam cito purpureos deperdit terra colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec varios discet mentiri lana colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iris, Mille trahens varios adverso sole colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 701</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere, of grapes, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to acquire color</tr>, <tr>become colored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 485</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:30" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9156.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9156.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Coloring stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dyestuff</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionis naturā minii et chrysocollae et aliorum colorum ferax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:60" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:30 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 12, § 30 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9156.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Flowers</hi> of varied colors: <cit><quote lang="la">aspice quo submittat humus formosa colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:492" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 492</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9156.6" n="B" level="2"> Specif., <hi rend="ital">the natural color of men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the complexion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui color, nitor, vestitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae autem dignitas coloris bonitate tuenda est, color exercitationibus corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venusti oculi, color suavis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verus (opp. to paint),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit> Don.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 164</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and fucatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:10" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex colore mustellino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">niveus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">albus,</quote> <trans><tr>fair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:21" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vide Num ejus color pudoris signum indicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: colorem mutare, <hi rend="ital">to change</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lose color</hi> (on account of any excitement of the passions, from shame, fear, pain, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to blush</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 38</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 19, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">color excidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo perturbavit ea vox regem, ut non color, non voltus ei constaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 34, 7</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n9156.7" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo nullius coloris,</quote> <trans><tr>an unknown man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 99</bibl></cit> (like the phrase: albus an ater sit; v. albus).—</sense><sense id="n9156.8" n="2" level="3"> Sometimes for <hi rend="ital">beautiful complexion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine tint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o formose puer, nimium ne crede colori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo fugit Venus, heu, quove color?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 141</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9156.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9156.10" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">color</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">external form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outward show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi> (predominant in rhet.; v. 2.; elsewh. rare, and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">amisimus omnem non modo sucum ac sanguinem, sed etiam colorem et speciem pristinam civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: omnis Aristippum decuit color et status et res, <hi rend="ital">every color became him</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">he accommodated himself to every condition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 23</bibl>: novimus quosdam, qui multis apud philosophum annis persederint, et ne colorem quidem duxerint, <hi rend="ital">have not acquired even the outward appearance</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">have imbibed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">learned nothing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 59</bibl>: omnia eundem ducunt colorem; <cit><quote lang="la">nec Persis Macedonum mores adumbrare nec Macedonibus Persas imitari indecorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:3:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 3, 14</bibl></cit> Vogel ad loc. —</sense><sense id="n9156.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A class</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9156.12" n="a" level="4"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">hos maxime laudat.. egregium hoc quoque, sed secundae sortis ingenium ... hic tertius color est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 52:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 52, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertium illud genus... sed ne hic quidem contemnendus est color tertius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 75:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 75, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni vitae colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2</bibl></cit> prooem. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n9156.13" n="b" level="4"> Esp., of diction, <hi rend="ital">character</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coloring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">style</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatur igitur oratio genere primum et quasi colore quodam et suco suo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 3, 25, 95</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 52, 199</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non unus color prooemii, narrationis, argumentorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui est, inquit, iste tandem urbanitatis color?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:171" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color dicendi maculis conspergitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">color totus orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplicis atque inaffectati gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tragicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum colores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9156.14" n="B" level="2"> Pregn. (cf. supra, 1. B. 2.), <hi rend="ital">a beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brilliant quality</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lustre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brilliancy</hi> (freq. only in rhet. lang.): <cit><quote lang="la">nullus argento color est avaris Abdito terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9156.15" n="2" level="3"> Of diction. </sense><sense id="n9156.16" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lively coloring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellishment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intelleges nihil illius (Catonis) lineamentis nisi eorum pigmentorum quae inventa nondum erant, florem et colorem defuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:87:298" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 87, 298</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13</bibl> (15 a), 2.—</sense><sense id="n9156.17" n="b" level="4"> In a bad sense, t. t., <hi rend="ital">an artful concealment of a fault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pretext</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palliation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 88</bibl> Spald.; 6, 5, 5; 10, 1, 116; 11, 1, 81; 12, 1, 33; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:3:25" default="NO">3, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res illo colore defenditur apud judicem, ut videatur ille non sanae mentis fuisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: sub colore adipiscendae possessionis, Cod. Th. 3, 6, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:280" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 280</bibl>. <cb n="COLO" /></sense></entryFree>
colorabilis: <entryFree id="n9157" type="main" key="co^lo_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlōrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = chromaticus, q. v., <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 942</bibl>.</entryFree>
colorate: <entryFree id="n9158" type="main" key="co^lo_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlōrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. coloro, <sense id="n9158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
colorator: <entryFree id="n9159" type="gloss" key="co^lo_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlōrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a polisher</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">stilbwth/s</foreign> et <foreign lang="greek">indikopla/sths</foreign>, Gloss. Lat.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 887, 3</bibl>.—Name of a comedy of Laberius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 9, 4.</sense></entryFree>
coloratus: <entryFree id="n9160" type="main" key="co^lo_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. coloro, <sense id="n9160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi></sense></entryFree>
coloreus: <entryFree id="n9161" type="main" key="co^lo_re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlōrĕus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>color</etym>, <sense id="n9161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variegated</hi> (rare, mostly class.): gausapes coloriae, August. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 80</bibl> P.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicae coloreae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coloro: <entryFree id="n9162" type="main" key="co^lo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n9162.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To give a color to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tinge</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:39:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.
