D. 1, 39, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum sinopide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 13, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineas testa trita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 3, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum rubricā vel atramento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 228" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloratum Tithoni conjuge caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 5, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9162.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to color reddish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brownish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tinge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in sole ambulem, natura fit ut colorer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 13, 16: <cit><quote lang="la">colorat aequora Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9162.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (cf. color, II.). </sense><sense id="n9162.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to imbue thoroughly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia nisi alte descendit et diu sedit animum non coloravit, sed infecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:30" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9162.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n9162.5" n="1" level="3"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">to give it a coloring;</hi> and in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to retain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">receive a coloring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be tinged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum istos libros studiosius legerim, sentio orationem meam illorum tactu quasi colorari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 13, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanitate quādam quasi colorata oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:170" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 46, 170</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9162.6" n="2" level="3"> (In a bad sense.) <hi rend="ital">To give a coloring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gloss over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palliate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:2:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inepta sua serio vultu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 2, 35</bibl></cit> (cf. color, II. B. b.).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n9162.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9162.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">colored red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imbrowned</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <trans><tr>having a healthy color</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 19; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis speciosior et coloratior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Seres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etrusci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:68" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9162.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">specious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficta et colorata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 16:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlōrātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a specious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plausible manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">offert tale patrocinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 285" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 285</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colos: <entryFree id="n9163" type="main" key="co^los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlos</orth>, v. color <sense id="n9163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
colossae: <entryFree id="n9164" type="main" key="Co^lossae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏlossae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kolossai/</foreign>, <sense id="n9164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Phrygia on the Lycus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Khonas; to the church in this place Paul</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s Epistle to the Colossians was addressed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 41, § 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Col. 1, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9164.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏlos-senses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Colossians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Colossœ</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Spir. Sanct. 2, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9164.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏlossīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kolossi=nos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Colossœ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 27, § 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colosseros: <entryFree id="n9165" type="greek" key="Co^losse^ro_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏlossĕrōs</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">*kolosso/s)/*erws</foreign>, the Colossal-love</etym>, <sense id="n9165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appellation of a large and beautiful man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colosseus: <entryFree id="n9166" type="greek" key="co^losse_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlossēus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-ossiaeus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 26</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kolossiai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n9166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">colossal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">huge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gigantic</hi> (post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">statuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colosseum se pingi Nero jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 7, 33, § 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colossicus: <entryFree id="n9167" type="greek" key="co^lossi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlossĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kolossiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n9167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">colossal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gigantic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum colossicon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 54</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> Gr. colossicoteros, -a, <case>acc.</case> -an, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:5:9, p. 98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 5, 9, p. 98</bibl> Bip., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2:4, p. 292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 4, p. 292</bibl> id. (prob. to be written with Greek letters).</sense></entryFree>
colossus: <entryFree id="n9168" type="greek" key="co^lossus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlossus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kolosso/s</foreign>, <sense id="n9168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gigantic statue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colossus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:51" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 51</bibl>.—In partic., <hi rend="ital">the celebrated Colossus at Rhodes;</hi> it was dedicated to the sun, and was 70 ells high, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 18</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=58:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 58, 2</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
colostra: <entryFree id="n9169" type="main" key="co^lostra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlostra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏlustra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlo-stra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:38:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 38, 2</bibl>; in <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlostrum</orth>, Mart. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 2, 22</bibl>), <sense id="n9169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first milk after delivery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the biestings</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 33, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:236" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 41, 96, § 236</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 13, 1</bibl>.—As a dainty dish, Mart. l. l.—As a term of endearment, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 154</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 177</bibl>; Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 84, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colostratio: <entryFree id="n9170" type="hapax" key="co^lostra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlostrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>colostrum</etym>, <sense id="n9170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease of the young caused by the first milk</hi> <cb n="COLU" /> <hi rend="ital">of the mother</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 41, 96, § 236</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n9170.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlostrāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">those afflicted with</hi> colostratio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 33, § 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colostrum: <entryFree id="n9171" type="main" key="co^lostrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlostrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. colostra.</entryFree>
colotes: <entryFree id="n9172" type="greek" key="co_lo_tes1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlōtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kwlw/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n9172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of lizard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also stellio</hi>, ascalabotes, <hi rend="ital">and</hi> galeotes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 29, 46, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:90" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 28, § 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9173" type="main" key="Co_lo_tes2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōlōtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kwlwth/s</foreign>. <sense id="n9173.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Epicurean philosopher of Lampsacus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:7:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9173.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A painter of Teos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9173.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:54" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 8, 34, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colpa: <entryFree id="n9174" type="gloss" key="colpa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">colpa</orth>, v. culpa.</entryFree>
coluber: <entryFree id="n9175" type="main" key="co^lu^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlŭber</orth>, <itype>bri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>akin to celer</etym>, <sense id="n9175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a serpent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snake</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 320</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 418</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 471</bibl> (an imitation of Hom. Il. 22, 93: <foreign lang="greek">w(s de\ dra/kwn, k.t.l.</foreign>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 620</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 775</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:231" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 231</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9175.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., as an attributive of the hair of Medusa, the Furies, the Hydra, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 664</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:175" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colubra: <entryFree id="n9176" type="main" key="co^lu_^bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlū^bra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coluber</etym>, <sense id="n9176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female serpent;</hi> and in gen., <hi rend="ital">a serpent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snake</hi>, Lucil., Turp., and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 201, 22 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 559</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:103" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:230" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 230</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 5, 19, § 53</bibl>.—As an attributive of the hair of the Furies, Medusa, etc. (v. coluber), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 474</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 491</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 783</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 634</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, prov.: quas tu edes colubras?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>art thou frantic?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 50</bibl></cit> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> and: <cit><quote lang="la">colubra restem non parit,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>like produces like</tr>, <tr>the thorn does not produce grapes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colubrifer: <entryFree id="n9177" type="main" key="co^lubri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlubrĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coluberfero</etym>, <sense id="n9177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serpent-bearing</hi>, an epithet of Medusa (cf. coluber and colubra): <cit><quote lang="la">monstrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 677</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colubrimodus: <entryFree id="n9178" type="hapax" key="co^lubri^mo^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlubrĭmŏdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coluber-modus</etym>, <sense id="n9178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serpent-like</hi>: capilli, Coripp. Fragm. 4.</sense></entryFree>
colubrinus: <entryFree id="n9179" type="main" key="co^lubri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlubrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coluber</etym>, <sense id="n9179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a serpent;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wily</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis gestūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9179.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlubrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> bryonia <hi rend="ital">and</hi> dracontea, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colubrosus: <entryFree id="n9180" type="hapax" key="co^lubro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlubrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serpentine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actus (viae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
colum: <entryFree id="n9181" type="main" key="co_lum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n9181.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A vessel for straining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a strainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colander</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 242</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:70" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:4" default="NO">12, 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:7" default="NO">12, 38, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 52, § 173</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 130, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 156 al" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 156 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colum nivarium, for cooling wine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:103" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 103</bibl></cit> inscr.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 2</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n9181.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bow-net</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a net of wicker-work for catching fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wear</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 57</bibl>; cf. 2. colo.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n9182" type="main" key="co_lum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlum</orth>, = colon, q. v.</entryFree>
columba: <entryFree id="n9183" type="main" key="co^lumba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>columbus</etym>, <sense id="n9183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pigeon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 34, 52, § 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 506</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 605</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 6, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 32</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">as sacred to Venus: Cythereiades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 386</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 197" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 197</bibl>.—As a term of endearment, <hi rend="ital">my dove</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:1:50 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 1, 50 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
columbar: <entryFree id="n9184" type="main" key="co^lumbar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumbar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>columba</etym>, <sense id="n9184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of collar</hi> (so called from its similarity to the hole in a dove-cot), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
columbaria: <entryFree id="n9185" type="main" key="co^lumba_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumbārĭa</orth>, v. columbarius, II. B. 3.</entryFree>
columbarius: <entryFree id="n9186" type="main" key="co^lumba_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumbārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>columba</etym>, <sense id="n9186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to doves;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n9186.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-lumbārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dove-keeper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:7:5" default="NO">3, 7, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9186.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumbārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n9186.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A dove-cot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pigeon-house</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:6" default="NO">8, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:3" default="NO">8, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 9, 6, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:8:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 2, 8, § 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9186.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9186.5" n="1" level="3"> In archit., <hi rend="ital">the gain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mortise in which rafters</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joists lie</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9186.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A hole near the axle of a water-wheel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 9, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9186.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An opening in the side of a vessel for the oars to pass through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rowlock; plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbaria in summis lateribus navium loca concava, per quae eminent remi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=169:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 169, 8</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumbā-rĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an oarsman</hi>, as a term of reproach. Plaut. ap. Fest. l. l.—</sense><sense id="n9186.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A subterranean sepulchre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the walls of which were niches for urns of ashes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2975</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4513</bibl>; v. Dict. of Antiq. s. v. columbarium.</sense></entryFree>
columbatim: <entryFree id="n9187" type="hapax" key="co^lumba_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumbātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">after the manner of doves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like doves</hi>: da basia, Poët. ap. Anth. Lat. 1, 3, 219. <pb n="372" /> <cb n="COLU" /></sense></entryFree>
columbinaceus: <entryFree id="n9188" type="main" key="co^lumbi_na_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumbīnācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>columbinus</etym>, <sense id="n9188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a dove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus,</quote> <trans><tr>a young dove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:18:111" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 18, 111</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
columbinus: <entryFree id="n9189" type="main" key="co^lumbi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumbīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>columba</etym>, <sense id="n9189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a dove</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pigeon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dove-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 3</bibl>; so also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumbīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">little doves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:66" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 66</bibl>: ovum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 47, § 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 6, 27, § 46</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9189.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dove-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 7, 4, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 12, 32, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
columbor: <entryFree id="n9190" type="hapax" key="co^lumbor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumbor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bill</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kiss like doves</hi>, Maecenas ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
columbulatim: <entryFree id="n9191" type="hapax" key="co^lumbu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumbŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>columbulus</etym>, <sense id="n9191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the manner of little doves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like little doves</hi>: labra conserens labris, Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 9, 2</bibl>; cf. columbatim.</sense></entryFree>
columbulus: <entryFree id="n9192" type="main" key="co^lumbu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumbŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>columbus</etym>, <sense id="n9192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little dove</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 25, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
columbus: <entryFree id="n9193" type="main" key="co^lumbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ko/lumbos</foreign>; cf.: calvus, color</etym>, <sense id="n9193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a male dove</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cock - pigeon</hi> (and transf., of male persons), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=56" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:125" default="NO" valid="yes">68, 125</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 5</bibl>, </sense><sense id="n9193.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dove</hi> in gen. (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 9, 11, § 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
columella: <entryFree id="n9194" type="main" key="co^lu^mella1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlŭmella</orth> (in MSS. often <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlum-nella</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>columna, columen</etym>, <sense id="n9194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small column</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pillar</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9194.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The foot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pedestal of a catapult</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9194.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a pillar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prop</hi> (cf. columen), Lucil. ap. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9195" type="main" key="Co^lu^mella2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏlŭmella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen in the</hi> gens Junia; so, </sense><sense id="n9195.1" n="I" level="1"> M. Junius Moderatus Columella, <hi rend="ital">of Hispania Bœtica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncle of the following.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n9195.2" n="II" level="1"> L. Junius Moderatus Columella, <hi rend="ital">a well-known writer on husbandry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the first century of the Christian era. He was of Gades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and a companion of Seneca and Celsus;</hi> his writings, De Re Rustica and De Arboribus, are yet extant; v. Schne<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Scriptt. Rei Rust. II. 2 praef.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:185" default="NO">7, 10, 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 41, 63, § 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 9, 6</bibl>, §§ 51 and 52; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 19, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
columellaris: <entryFree id="n9196" type="main" key="co^lu^mella_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlŭmellāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n9196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi> [columella], <hi rend="ital">pillar-formed</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <trans><tr>the grinders of horses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 64, § 168</bibl>; in vulg. Lat. colomelli, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 1, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
columen: <entryFree id="n9197" type="main" key="co^lu^men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlŭmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cul-men</orth>, <itype>mis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root cel- of excello; cf.: celsus, culmus, calamus, collis</etym>, lit., <sense id="n9197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which rises in height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is prominent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projects;</hi> hence <hi rend="ital">the point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ridge.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9197.1" n="I" level="1"> Form <itype>columen, inis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (only this form is used by Plautus, v. Ritschl, prol. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> p. 65</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n9197.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An elevated object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pillar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">column</hi>: ego vitam agam sub altis Phrygiae columinibus, <hi rend="ital">the lofty buildings</hi>, or perh. <hi rend="ital">the mountain-heights</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 71</bibl> Ellis ad loc.; and of <hi rend="ital">a pillar of fire</hi>: Phoebi fax, tristis nunt a belli, quae magnum ad columen flammato ardore volabat, <hi rend="ital">like an ascending column</hi>, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 11, 18.— </sense><sense id="n9197.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The highest part</hi> or <hi rend="ital">top of an object</hi>, e. g. of a wall; <hi rend="ital">the coping;</hi> Fr. <hi rend="ital">le chaperon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 15, 1</bibl>; of a building, <hi rend="ital">a ridge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a roof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in turribus et columinibus villae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1000" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1000</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thyest. 54</bibl> Gron.; so of the Capitol, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 12, 20, and of the <hi rend="ital">culmination</hi> of heavenly bodies: oritur Canicula cum Cancro, in columen venit cum Geminis, Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 218</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9197.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the height</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">columen amicorum Antonii, Cotyla Varius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars haec vitae jam pridem pervenit ad columen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 17, § 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">audaciae,</quote> <trans><tr>the crown of impudence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 211</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9197.5" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An elevated object that supports</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustains something;</hi> in archit., <hi rend="ital">the top of a gable-end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gable pillar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7, 5</bibl>.—Esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n9197.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:76:section=176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 76, § 176</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senati, praesidium popli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii Romani, Div 38, 51, 3: regni Ausonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:385" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum mearum (Maecenas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrinarum, artium (Varro et Nigidius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9197.7" n="II" level="1"> <itype>culmen, ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (in Cic. only once; cf. the foll. B.; not in Cat., Lucr., or Hor.; in <cb n="COLU" /> gen. first freq. since the Aug. per.). * </sense><sense id="n9197.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Any thing high;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, of the <hi rend="ital">stalk</hi> of a bean, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:734" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 734</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9197.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summit</hi>, e. g. of a building, <hi rend="ital">a roof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cupola</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">columen in summo fastigio culminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 295</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 289</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta domorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 446</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 458</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">culmina hominum, deorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of houses and temples</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 671</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 3, 7</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the dome</hi> of heaven, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 26</bibl>. —Of <hi rend="ital">mountain summits</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarpeium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 23</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the crown of the head of men</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 9</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the top of the prow of a ship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 709</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n9197.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the summit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acme</hi>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">point of culmination</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">a summo culmine fortunae ad ultimum finem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principium culmenque (columenque, Sillig) omnium rerum pretii margaritae tenent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruit alta a culmine Troja,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 290</bibl></cit> (Hom. Il. 13, 772: <foreign lang="greek">kat) a)/krhs</foreign>); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 603</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de summo culmine lapsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 64</bibl></cit>. pastorale, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Get. 355</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
columis: <entryFree id="n9198" type="gloss" key="co^lu^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlŭmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n9198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unhurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safe;</hi> Gloss. Isid.: <cit><quote lang="la">colume sanum, and columes salvos. (But,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>, the true reading is incolumem; v. prol. ad Trin. p. 68 Ritschl.)</sense></entryFree>
columna: <entryFree id="n9199" type="main" key="co^lumna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root cel- of excello; v. columen, of which it is orig. a collat. form</etym>. <sense id="n9199.0" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A projecting object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a column</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post</hi> (very freq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae et templa et porticus sustinent, tamen habent non plus utilitatis quam dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 180</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 51</bibl>, §§ 133 and 134; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae Doricae, Ionicae, Tuscanicae, Corinthiae, Atticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:178 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 56, § 178 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl> sqq.: Rostrata, <hi rend="ital">a column ornamented with beaks of ships</hi>, erected in honor of Duellius, the conqueror of the Carthaginians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 12</bibl> Spald.; fragments of the inscription on it are yet extant, v. in the Appendix: Maenia, also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Columna, <hi rend="ital">a pillory</hi> in the Forum Romanum, where thieves, criminal slaves, and debtors were judged and punished, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:16:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 16, 50</bibl> Ascon.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: ad columnam pervenire. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhaerescere ad columnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. Dict. of Antiq. s. v. columna.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae, as the sign of a bookseller's shop,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> A. P 373</bibl></cit> Orell. ad loc.—From the use of pillars to designate boundaries of countries: <cit><quote lang="la">Columnae Protei = fines Aegypti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 262</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Columnae Herculis, i. e. Calpe et Abyla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:8" default="NO">2, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3</bibl>, prooem. § 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 34</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">incurrere amentem in columnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:67:224" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 67, 224</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n9199.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a pillar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support;</hi> of Augustus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9199.2" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">objects resembling a pillar;</hi> so, </sense><sense id="n9199.3" n="a" level="4"> Of the arm (comice): <cit><quote lang="la">ecce autem aedificat: columnam mento suffigit suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9199.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A water-spout</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 426</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:433" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 433</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 49, 50, § 134</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9199.5" n="c" level="4"> Of fire, <hi rend="ital">a meteor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:20:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 20, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the pillar of cloud and of fire which guided the Exodus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:13:21 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 13, 21 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n9199.6" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Membrum virile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:49" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:51" default="NO">11, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 9, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9199.7" n="e" level="4"> Narium recta pars eo quod aequaliter sit in longitudine et rotunditate porrecta, columna vocatur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 1, 48</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n9199.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summit;</hi> so only once of <hi rend="ital">the dome of heaven</hi>, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 12, 21; cf. columen.</sense></entryFree>
columnar: <entryFree id="n9200" type="main" key="co^lumnar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumnar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for columnarium</etym>, <sense id="n9200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stone-quarry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marble-quarry</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4034</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
columnaris: <entryFree id="n9201" type="hapax" key="co^lumna_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumnāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>columna</etym>, <sense id="n9201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rising in the form of a pillar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <trans><tr>a pillar of fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 476</bibl></cit> (in imitation of the Heb. <foreign />, Exod. 13, 21); cf. columnifer.</sense></entryFree>
columnarium: <entryFree id="n9202" type="main" key="co^lumna_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. columnarius, II.</entryFree>
columnarius: <entryFree id="n9203" type="main" key="co^lumna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>columna</etym>, <sense id="n9203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a column;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, * </sense><sense id="n9203.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who was condemned at the</hi> Columna Maenia (v. columna, A.); therefore <hi rend="ital">a criminal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">debtor</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 9, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9203.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlum-nārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a tribute for the pillars of a house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pillar-tax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32</bibl>; cf. columnar.</sense></entryFree>
columnatio: <entryFree id="n9204" type="main" key="co^lumna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a supporting by pillars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 18, p. 359, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
columnatus: <entryFree id="n9205" type="main" key="co^lumna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">supported<cb n="COMA" />  by posts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pillars</hi> (perh. only in the foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">tholus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversoria, Ambros. de Cain et Abel, 1, 5, 19: pons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1206,001:Lib. Mem. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Ampel.</author> Lib. Mem. 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—Humorously: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>supported upon the hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
columnella: <entryFree id="n9206" type="main" key="co^lumnella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumnella</orth>, v. columella.</entryFree>
columnifer: <entryFree id="n9207" type="hapax" key="co^lumni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlumnĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>columna-fero</etym>, <sense id="n9207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">column-bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radius,</quote> <trans><tr>a pillar of fire</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. columnaris.</sense></entryFree>
coluri: <entryFree id="n9208" type="main" key="co^lu_ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlūri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. colurus.</entryFree>
colurnus: <entryFree id="n9209" type="main" key="co^lurnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlurnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>transp. for corulnus, from corulus = corylus</etym>, <sense id="n9209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of the hazel-bush</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 396</bibl></cit> Serv.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 595</bibl> P.: hastilia, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=37:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 37, 7</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
colurus: <entryFree id="n9210" type="greek" key="co^lu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/louros</foreign>, <sense id="n9210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mutilated;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n9210.1" n="I" level="1"> In astron.: coluri circuli, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/louroi</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the colures</hi>, two circles passing through the equinoctial and solstitial points, and cutting each other at right angles at the poles, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 15</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9210.2" n="II" level="1"> In metre: metrum, <hi rend="ital">a syllable too short</hi>, Plotius, Metr. p. 2649 P.</sense></entryFree>
colus: <entryFree id="n9211" type="main" key="co^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlus</orth> (i and), ūs (cf. Prisc. pp. 654 and 719 P.; Rudd. 1, p. 166, n. 100), <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 311</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:72" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 1, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:9:48" default="NO">4, 9, 48</bibl>) [root prob. kar-, to be bent or round; cf.: corona, curvus, collum], <sense id="n9211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distaff; sing. nom.</hi> colus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:63" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 194</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 594</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> colus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:148" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 148</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> colum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 312</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 116</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> colo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:86" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 72; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 409</bibl> (quoted by <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 719</bibl> P.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 702</bibl>; App. de Mundo, p. 755: colu, Opimius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 277</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:380" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 380</bibl> (quoted by <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 719</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:90" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 15, 53, § 90</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and varying between colo and colu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 48 (Kuin., Lachm., and Jacob., colu); <hi rend="ital">plur. nom.</hi> colus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:242" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 242</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 839</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> colos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:818" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 818</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:47" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:18" default="NO">9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:64" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 172</bibl> (Bip. colus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 5, 150</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 1, 582</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 635</bibl>; Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 389</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idyll. 49, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 559" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 559</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 668" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 668</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:445" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 445</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:645" default="NO">6, 645</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:649" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 649</bibl> (varying, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:249" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 249</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Ruperti, colus).—As an attribute of the Parcae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:242" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 242</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 380</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 559" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 559</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n9211.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">the thread spun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 668" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 668</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colutea: <entryFree id="n9212" type="greek" key="co^lu_te^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlūtĕa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koloute/a, h(</foreign>, <sense id="n9212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pod-like kind of fruit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 7</bibl> dub. (Ritschl, colyphia).</sense></entryFree>
coluthia: <entryFree id="n9213" type="main" key="colu_thi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">colūthĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n9213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of snail of a dark color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 27, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:147" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colymbas: <entryFree id="n9214" type="greek" key="co^lymba^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlymbăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kolumba/s</foreign> (swimming; hence): olivae, <sense id="n9214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prepared</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put in brine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 47, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:73" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 3, 36, § 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 22, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colymbus: <entryFree id="n9215" type="greek" key="co^lymbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlymbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/lumbos</foreign>, <sense id="n9215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swimming-bath</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 23</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">ste/f</foreign>. 12, 36.</sense></entryFree>
colyphia: <entryFree id="n9216" type="greek" key="co_ly_phi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlȳphĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-līphĭa</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ kwlu/fia</foreign>, <sense id="n9216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">choice bits of meat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loin-pieces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collyrae facite ut madeant et Colyphia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit> Ritschl: <cit><quote lang="la">comedunt colyphia paucae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 53</bibl></cit> Jan.—Form coliphia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:67:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 67, 12</bibl>; cf. Schne<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:ad Veg. 6:12, p. 105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Veg. 6, 12, p. 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
colyx: <entryFree id="n9217" type="greek" key="co^lyx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlyx</orth>, <itype>ycos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n9217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cavern where natron is distilling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
com: <entryFree id="n9218" type="main" key="co^m"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏm</orth>, v. 1. cum, III.</entryFree>
coma: <entryFree id="n9219" type="greek" key="co^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/mh</foreign>, <sense id="n9219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hair of the head</hi> (hence barba comaeque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 288</bibl>), considered as an ornament for the head: comae dicuntur capilli cum aliquā curā compositi, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=63:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 63, 13</bibl> Müll. (class., esp. in poetry and post-Aug. prose; very rare in Cic.).—With <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentis effluens calamistrata coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> post Red. in Sen. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: fulva, <foreign lang="greek">canqh/</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flava,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:44" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrtea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:28" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 10, 14; cf.: spissā te nitidum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odorata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 734</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ambrosiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:86" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virides Nereidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 28, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regia (of Berenice),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventis horrida facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dare diffundere ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 319</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">verb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deciderint comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: ne comae turbarentur, quas componi post paulum vetuit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:148" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:21:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 88</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inustas comere acu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <pb n="373" /> <cb n="COMB" /> pectere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gradus frangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">formare in gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longam renodare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:28" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 11, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">positu variare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 412</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:406" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">componere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rutilare et summittere (after the manner of the Germans),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sertis implicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delphicā lauro cingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in a Gr. constr.: fronde comas vincti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 110</bibl></cit>: scindens dolore intonsam comam, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 62</bibl> (transl. of Hom. Il. 10, 15).—So of Venus lamenting Adonis: <cit><quote lang="la">effusā isse comā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 13, 56; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a Gr. constr.: scissa comam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 478</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 139</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 110</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9219.1" n="b" level="4"> Of animals, of <hi rend="ital">the golden fleece</hi>: agnus aureā clarus comā, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:26:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 26, 68</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 211 Rib.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 736" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 736</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">The mane</hi> of lions, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the horse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n9219.2" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The crest of a helmet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:389" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 389</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9219.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of objects resembling the hair in appearance or in ornamental effect; most freq. acc. to a trope common in most languages, of leaves, grass, etc., <hi rend="ital">foliage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ears</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grass</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">stalks</hi> of trees, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 16, 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:48" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 2, 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Am 3, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> F 4, 438</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:277" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 277</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:53" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 7, 10, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:102" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 6, 32, § 102</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n9219.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The wool</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hair upon parchment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:1:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 1, 10</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">the rays of light</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:99" default="NO" valid="yes">61, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 311" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 311</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 727" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 727</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comacum: <entryFree id="n9220" type="main" key="comacum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comacum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cama-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n9220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cinnamon found in Syria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 28, 63, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 2, 2, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes">1</bibl>, ind. l<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 12, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comagene: <entryFree id="n9221" type="main" key="Co_ma_ge_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōmāgēnē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōmāgēnus</orth>, v. Commagene.</entryFree>
comana: <entryFree id="n9222" type="main" key="Co^ma_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏmāna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ko/mana</foreign>. <sense id="n9222.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Cappadocia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Sarus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">El Bostan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 3, 3, § 8</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 66; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Nov 31:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Nov 31, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏmānenses</orth>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 47, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9222.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Pontus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Iris</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Gumenek</hi>, near <hi rend="ital">Tokat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 3, 4, § 10</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 34; 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Nov. 31:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Nov. 31, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comans: <entryFree id="n9223" type="main" key="co^mans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, v. 2 como.</entryFree>
comarchus: <entryFree id="n9224" type="greek" key="co_marchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kw/marxos</foreign>, <sense id="n9224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief</hi> or <hi rend="ital">governor of a village</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a burgomaster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comaron: <entryFree id="n9225" type="greek" key="co^ma^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmăron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/maron</foreign>. <sense id="n9225.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The fruit of the arbute-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 28, § 99</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9225.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> fragum, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comatorius: <entryFree id="n9226" type="main" key="co^ma_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coma</etym>, <sense id="n9226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the hair;</hi> acus, <hi rend="ital">a hair-pin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comatulus: <entryFree id="n9227" type="main" key="co^ma_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmātŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n9227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [comatus], <hi rend="ital">having hair neatly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">luxuriously curled</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 66</bibl></cit>, n. 8; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 54</bibl>, n. 13.</sense></entryFree>
