comatus: <entryFree id="n9228" type="main" key="co^ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. como.</entryFree>
combe: <entryFree id="n9229" type="main" key="Combe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Combē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n9229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mother of the Curetes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 383</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
combennones: <entryFree id="n9230" type="gloss" key="combenno^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">combennŏnes</orth>, v benna.</entryFree>
combibo: <entryFree id="n9231" type="main" key="combi^bo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-bĭbo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conb-</orth>), <itype>bĭbi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n9231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9231.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drink with any one as a companion</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aeque combibendi et convivandi peritissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9231.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drink completely up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to absorb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to imbibe</hi> (the most common signif., rare before the Aug. per., in Cic. only once trop.). </sense><sense id="n9231.3" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">combibunt guttura sucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:944" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 944</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 287</bibl>: atrum venenum corpo re, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore lacrimas alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas meas,</quote> <trans><tr>to repress</tr>, <tr>conceal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 54</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 49:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 49, 1</bibl>. —Of the absorbing of the rays of the sun: <cit><quote lang="la">cute soles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:12:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 12, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll.—</sense><sense id="n9231.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to inanimate objects: <cit><quote lang="la">metreta amurcam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 100</bibl></cit> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara cruorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testa oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:17, p. 527" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 17, p. 527</bibl></cit> Bip.: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae mustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 39, 1</bibl></cit>' caepa jus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">baca salem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:10, p. 519" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 47, 10, p. 519</bibl></cit> Bip.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic modo combibitur ingens Erasinus in arvis,</quote> <trans><tr>is swallowed up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 275</bibl></cit>.—Of the absorbing of the sun's rays: <cit><quote lang="la">scrobes solem pluviasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 80</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus flammas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:675" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 675</bibl></cit>.—And <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of imbibing, i. e. receiving spots (after perfundere): <cit><quote lang="la">combibit os maculas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 455</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9231.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: artes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 9</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">illapsos per viscera luxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:402" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 402</bibl></cit>. <cb n="COME" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9232" type="main" key="combi^bo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">combĭbo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conb-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. combibo</etym>, <sense id="n9232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pot-companion</hi>, perh. only Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 38, 13</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 25, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
combinatio: <entryFree id="n9233" type="gloss" key="combi_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">combīnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>combino</etym>, <sense id="n9233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining two by two</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">zeu=cis kata\ du/o</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
combino: <entryFree id="n9234" type="main" key="combi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-bīno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conb-</orth>), no <sense id="n9234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>bini</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to unite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combine</hi> (late Lat.): combinat <foreign lang="greek">zeugnu)ei, suna/ptei</foreign>, Gloss. Lat.; <foreign lang="greek">zeugi/zw</foreign> combino, Gloss. Gr. Lat.; <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> combinatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
combretum: <entryFree id="n9235" type="main" key="combre_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">combrētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n9235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of rush</hi>, perh. Juncus maximus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 16, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:133" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 19, 77, § 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
combullio: <entryFree id="n9236" type="main" key="combulli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-bullĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conb-</orth>), <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to boil fully</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:8:section=397" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 8, § 397</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comburo: <entryFree id="n9237" type="main" key="combu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-būro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conb-</orth>), <itype>ussi, ustum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root bur-, pur-; cf. burrus, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">purro/s</foreign>, pruna, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pi/mprhmi</foreign>, and Lat. bustum</etym>, <sense id="n9237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to burn up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n9237.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: quae potuere Nec cum capta capi, nec cum combusta cremari, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 360 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">fumo comburi nihil potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma comburens impete magno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is ejus (solis) tactus est, ut saepe comburat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum omne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 63</bibl>; Liv 33, 11, 1: religiosas vestes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 52</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Hisp. 20; <cit><quote lang="la">so of persons: et patrem et filium vivos conburere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; Serv ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 10, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9237.2" n="B" level="2"> <pos>P. a.</pos>, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>' <orth extent="full" lang="la">combu-stum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a burn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wound made by burning</hi> combusta sanare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">combustis mederi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 69, § 141</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9237.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> comburere aliquem judicio, <hi rend="ital">to ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 6</bibl> (v. the passage in connection). So <hi rend="ital">to be consumed by love</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 30, 29: diem <hi rend="ital">to pass it in carousing</hi>, q. s. <hi rend="ital">to bear it to its grave</hi> (the figure borrowed from burning dead bodies), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
combustio: <entryFree id="n9238" type="hapax" key="combusti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">combustĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>comburo</etym>, <sense id="n9238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consuming</hi>, Firm. Math. 4, 12.</sense></entryFree>
combustum: <entryFree id="n9239" type="main" key="combustum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">combustum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v comburo, I. B.</entryFree>
combustura: <entryFree id="n9240" type="main" key="combustu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">combustūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n9240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [comburo], <hi rend="ital">a burning</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:4:section=179" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 4, § 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 13, 28</bibl>; Macer de Rosa, 21.</sense></entryFree>
combustus: <entryFree id="n9241" type="main" key="combustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">combustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from comburo.</entryFree>
come: <entryFree id="n9242" type="greek" key="co^me_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/mh</foreign>, <sense id="n9242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> tragopogon, prob Tragopogon crocifolius, Linn., <hi rend="ital">crocus leaved goat</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s- beard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 117, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9243" type="main" key="Co_me_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōmē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kw/mh</foreign> (a village). <sense id="n9243.0" n="I" level="1"> Come Hiera, <hi rend="ital">a town in Caria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a temple and an oracle of Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 12, 9</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9243.1" n="II" level="1"> Xylina Come, <hi rend="ital">a small town in Pisidia</hi>, Liv 38, 15, 7.—</sense><sense id="n9243.2" n="III" level="1"> Acoridos Come, <hi rend="ital">a small town in Phrygia</hi>, Liv 38, 15, 12 Weissenb. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
comedo: <entryFree id="n9244" type="main" key="co^me^do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏm-ĕdo</orth>, <itype>ēdi, ēsum</itype> (comessum, Prol. ad Plaut. p 102 Ritschl), or <itype>estum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (comesus, the more usual form, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 58</bibl>; Varr R. R. 1, 2, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 5</bibl>, Juv 1, 34; Valgius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 382</bibl> P—Hence, comessurus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 25</bibl>: <sense id="n9244.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">comestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 173</bibl>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 893</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12</bibl>, ext. 6, and Didius ap. Diom. l. l.—Contr forms: <cit><quote lang="la">comes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 20</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 36</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Lucil, Titin., Afran., Varr., Cic. Hortens. ap. Non p. 81, 9 sq., comestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 8</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 36, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comesses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:39:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 39, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:51:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 51, 110</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comesto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 1</bibl></cit>.—Old forms: <cit><quote lang="la">comedim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 91</bibl>; Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 83, 32</bibl> comedis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comedint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 53</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">to eat entirely up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in Plaut.). </sense><sense id="n9244.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi oleae comesae erunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi daps profanata comestaque erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bibit, quod comest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corbitam cibi Comesse possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid comedent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celerius potuit (venenum) comestum quam epotum in venas permanare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex se enim natos comesse fingitur solitus (Saturnus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:25:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 25, 64</bibl></cit>: quorum<cb n="COME" />  Dentes vel silicem comesse possunt. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec porcis hodie comedenda relinques,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: te muscae comedissent, Sicinius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:217" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 60, 217</bibl>; and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:129" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 129</bibl>: panem, Afer ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:93" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 93</bibl>.—Facetiously: lacertum Largii, Crass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 240</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9244.2" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">tam facile vinces quam pirum volpes comest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; and: cenà comesā venire, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to come too late;</hi> post festum, <hi rend="ital">a day after the fair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9244.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: comedere aliquem oculis, <hi rend="ital">to devour with one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s eyes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to long eagerly for</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:60:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 60, 3</bibl>: se, <hi rend="ital">to consume one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi> (<hi rend="ital">by grief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorrow</hi>, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to waste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pine away</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 36</bibl>; so Cic. Hortens. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 81, 29</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9244.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissipate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squander</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comedunt quod habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum in lustris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 91</bibl></cit>. meam dotem comest, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 81, 16</bibl>: paternam pecuniam, Novius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 81, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura ut valeas, ne ego te jacente bona tua comedim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:52:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 52, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem (sc. familiarem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:51:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 51, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 36, 91</bibl>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 83, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantherium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>its value in money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 4</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n9244.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> in the lang. of comedy: comedere aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to waste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consume the property of any person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:11 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 11 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9245" type="main" key="co^me^do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĕdo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĕdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=58:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 58, 6</bibl> Müll.; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 139</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. comedo</etym>, <sense id="n9245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glutton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gormandizer</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 11, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. p. 93:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. p. 93, 21</bibl>; cf. Paul. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
comensis: <entryFree id="n9246" type="main" key="Co_mensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōmensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Comum, II.</entryFree>
comes: <entryFree id="n9247" type="main" key="co^me^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏm-ĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>con and 1. eo</etym> (lit. one who goes with another), <sense id="n9247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a companion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an associate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comrade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partner</hi>, etc. (whether male or female; class. and freq.). </sense><sense id="n9247.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n9247.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, age, argentum numera, ne comites morer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confugere domum sine comite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comes meus fuit, et omnium itinerum meorum socius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat comes ejus Rubrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:25:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 25, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui tu me comitem putas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibimus, o socii comitesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1037" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1037</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:575" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 575</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pisonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin et avo comitem sese Mavortius addet Romulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:778" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 778</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">comes ire alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitem aliquem mittere alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comes esse alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 54</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n9247.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dat. of thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se victoriae Pompeji comitem esse mallet quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitem illius furoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me tuarum actionum, sententiarum, etc., socium comitemque habebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis et funeris atri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantae virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:60:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 60, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:25" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:53" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me habuisti comitem consiliis tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comes in ulciscendis quibusdam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9247.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 741</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">data sum comes inculpata Minervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 588</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me tibi venturam comitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 163</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 677</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 448</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9247.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to inanimate objects: <cit><quote lang="la">malis erat angor Assidue comes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comes formidinis, aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ploratus mortis comites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 580</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc vitae socia virtus, mortis comes gloria fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 21, 49</bibl></cit> (17, 39): <cit><quote lang="la">multarum deliciarum comes est extrema saltatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis est comes, otiique socia eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 12, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">an idea (perh. intentionally) opp. to this,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ut ullam artem doctrinamve contemneres, sed ut omnis comites ac ministratrices oratoris esse diceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:17:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 17, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui ipsi casus eventusque rerum non duces sed comites consiliorum fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exanimatio. quas comes pavoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(grammatice) dulcis secretorum comes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cura) comes atra premit sequiturque fugacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam poena premit comes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec (fides) comitem abnegat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 22</bibl></cit>: comitemque <pb n="374" /> <cb n="COMI" /> aeris alieni atque litis esse miseriam, Orac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 32, 32, § 119</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9247.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n9247.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An overseer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tutor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teacher</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">of young persons</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not ante-Aug.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 546</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:60" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 60</bibl>.— Esp. = paedagogus, <hi rend="ital">a slave</hi> who accompanied boys as a protector, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 35</bibl>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n9247.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The suite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retinue of friends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relatives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scholars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble youth</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">which accompanied magistrates into the provinces</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 10, § 27</bibl> sq; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:3:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3, § 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n9247.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The attendants of distinguished private individuals</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: (Cicero) in libris de Republica Platonis se comitem profitetur, Plin. praef. § 22.—</sense><sense id="n9247.10" n="D" level="2"> After the time of the emperors, <hi rend="ital">the imperial train</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the courtiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">court</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 723</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">750 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9247.11" n="E" level="2"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">a designation for the occupant of any state office</hi>, as, comes scholarum, rei militaris, aerarii utriusque, commerciorum (hence, Ital. <hi rend="ital">conte;</hi> Fr. <hi rend="ital">comte</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
comesor: <entryFree id="n9248" type="main" key="co^me_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmēsor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmestor</orth>, Gloss. Philox.), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. comedo</etym>, <sense id="n9248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gourmand</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comestibilis: <entryFree id="n9249" type="main" key="co^mesti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmestĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eatable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comestio: <entryFree id="n9250" type="main" key="co^mesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmestĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a consuming</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 3, 90, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comestus: <entryFree id="n9251" type="main" key="co^mestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. comedo <sense id="n9251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
comesus: <entryFree id="n9252" type="main" key="co^me_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmēsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. comedo <sense id="n9252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9253" type="main" key="co^me_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmēsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. comedo</etym>, <sense id="n9253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consuming</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cometes: <entryFree id="n9254" type="greek" key="co^me_tes1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmētes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (Lat. access. form <case>nom.</case> cometa, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 12, 21</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> cometam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oct. 232" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oct. 232</bibl>; <sense id="n9254.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">cometem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 10, 272</bibl></cit>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:407" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 407</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> cometā, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 824</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">komh/ths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a comet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:89 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 89 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:1:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 1, 5</bibl> et l<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7</bibl> passim; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 10, 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:11:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 11, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 488</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:638" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 638</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:529 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 529 al.</bibl>—In apposition with sidus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 47</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with stella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 37, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9255" type="main" key="Co^me_tes2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏmētes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9255.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Lapithœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 284</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9255.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Father of Asterion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:356" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 356</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comice: <entryFree id="n9256" type="main" key="co_mi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. comicus <sense id="n9256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
comicus: <entryFree id="n9257" type="greek" key="co_mi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kwmiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n9257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to comedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:20:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans><tr>the material of comedy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:125" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: virtus (Terentii), C. Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Ter. 5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. Ter. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">persona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 88, § 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9257.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">represented in comedy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut comici servi solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: stulti senes, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 11, 36</bibl>, and Lael. 26, 99; so, <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Davus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moecha Thais,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 44: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum = lupinum,</quote> <trans><tr>lupines</tr>, <tr>used by comic actors instead of money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9257.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n9257.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An actor of comedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a comedian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1089, 6</bibl>. —More freq., </sense><sense id="n9257.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A comic poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">writer of comedy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:55:184" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 55, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:3" default="NO">2, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:14" default="NO">9, 3, 14</bibl>; 10, 1, 72; 11, 1, 38; 12, 2, 22.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of comedy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res tragicas tractare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 8, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 100:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 100, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cominium: <entryFree id="n9258" type="main" key="Co_mi^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōmĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n9258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Samnium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:39:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 39, 5 sq.</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:43:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 43, 1 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cominius: <entryFree id="n9259" type="main" key="Cominius1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cominius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36, 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut 78, 271</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n9260" type="main" key="cominius2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cominius</orth>, v. colminiana.</entryFree>
cominus: <entryFree id="n9261" type="main" key="co_mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmĭnus</orth>, v. comminus.</entryFree>
comis: <entryFree id="n9262" type="main" key="co_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. concinnus</etym>, <sense id="n9262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">courteous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loving</hi> (class. in prose and poetry; on account of similarity of meaning, in MSS. very freq. interchanged with communis; hence the readings vary in the best edd.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 12, 9</bibl> Drak.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> 2, p. 241</bibl> Wolf; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:25:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 25, 80</bibl> Madv.). </sense><sense id="n9262.1" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: comes, benigni, faciles, suaves homines esse dicuntur qui erranti comiter monstrant viam (Enn.; cf. under <pos>adv.</pos>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 16, 36</bibl>: illum negat et bonum virum et comem <cb n="COMI" /> et humanum fuisse, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:25:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 25, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illo usa sum benigno et lepido et comi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 39</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 39</bibl> Bentl. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">comis et humanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:25:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 25, 80</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis Laelio comior? quis jucundior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 31, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum illis comis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bonis (opp. adversus malos injucundus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comis erga aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 17, 59</bibl></cit> (al. communis, but comp. id. Fin. l. l. Madv.): <cit><quote lang="la">comis in amicitiis tuendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:25:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 25, 80 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in uxorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex comissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 268</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9262.2" n="B" level="2"> Of subjects not personal: <cit><quote lang="la">comi animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 36, 8</bibl></cit>, cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vinclum inter hospites comitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Halm: <cit><quote lang="la">sermone et congressu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viā (i. e. more),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis alliciendus amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 510</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">courteously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affably</hi>, etc. (very freq.): homo, qui erranti comiter monstrat viam, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 16, 51</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=89" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 89</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellare unumquemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera missa legatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 43, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 24, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 20, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 33, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:788" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 788</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitare regios juvenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celebrare regis convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 22, 5</bibl></cit> (al. leg. comi fronte): <cit><quote lang="la">administrare provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.; majestatem populi Romani comiter conservato, i. e. <hi rend="ital">willingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in an obliging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind manner</hi>, a (mildly expressed) formula in treaties of peace, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 16, 36</bibl>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:15:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 15, 7</bibl>; for which, in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 11, 2</bibl>. imperium majestatemque populi Romani gens Aetolorum conservato sine dolo malo.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 66</bibl> dub. (Ritschl, comptissume).—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> apparently not in use.</sense></entryFree>
comissabundus: <entryFree id="n9263" type="main" key="co_missa_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmissābundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cōmess-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>comissor</etym>, <sense id="n9263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">holding a riotous procession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">banqueting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carousing</hi>: comissabundus temulento agmine per Indiam incessit (Alexander Magnus; in regard to his imitation of the procession in honor of Bacchus through Asia; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 26</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:26" default="NO">9, 10, 26</bibl>: ubi (Athenis) comissabundi juvenes ante meridiem conventus sapientium frequentabant, <hi rend="ital">decorated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowned</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">for a procession</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 6, § 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comissaliter: <entryFree id="n9264" type="main" key="co_missa_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmissālĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cōmess-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, from an <pos>adj.</pos> comissalis, not in use [id.], <sense id="n9264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">as in revelling processions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wantonly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jovially</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comissatio: <entryFree id="n9265" type="main" key="co_missa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmissātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cōmess-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Bacchanalian revel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the succeeding nocturnal procession with torches and music</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a revelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rioting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:48:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 48, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9, 9</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=89" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 89</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:32:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 32, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 10:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 51:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 51, 1</bibl>.—The tropes tempestas comissationis and comissatio tempestatis are censured, the former as too bold and the latter as too feeble, by Cic., de Or. 3, 41, 164.</sense></entryFree>
comissator: <entryFree id="n9266" type="main" key="co_missa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmissātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cōmess-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who holds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joins in a festive procession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a reveller</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:28:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 28, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 65, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:62:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 62, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:14:4 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 14, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9266.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: libellus, <hi rend="ital">a book of songs used in a</hi> comissatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:16:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 16, 9</bibl>: comissatores conjurationis, in contempt for <hi rend="ital">the companions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">participants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Catilinian conspiracy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comissor: <entryFree id="n9267" type="greek" key="co_missor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmissor</orth> (on account of erroneous deriv. from comis, comedo, commensa, etc., often written <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmisor, commisor, commissor, cōmesor, cōmes-sor, commessor</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">commensor</orth>, etc.; v. Vel. Long. p. 2233; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 7, 5</bibl> Drak.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 57</bibl>; Spald. and Zumpt), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kwma/zw</foreign> (v. Lidd. and Scott in h. v.), <sense id="n9267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hold a festive procession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to revel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make merry;</hi> of young people, who went about with music and dancing, to celebrate a festival, and finally returned to one of their companions, in order to carouse anew (class.; not in Cic.; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, however, comissatio and comissator): nunc comissatum ibo ad Philolachetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fratrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui praetereat comissatum volo vocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5</bibl></cit>, <cb n="COMI" /> 4, 4: in domum alicujus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 11</bibl>: intromittere aliquam comissatum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 52</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">comissantium modo currum secuti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 29, 5</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 25, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comitabilis: <entryFree id="n9268" type="hapax" key="co^mi^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>comitor</etym>, <sense id="n9268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">attending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompanying</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 10, 298</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comitas: <entryFree id="n9269" type="main" key="co_mi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>comis</etym>, <sense id="n9269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">courteousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obligingness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentleness</hi> (syn.: benignitas, facilitas, humanitas; opp. gravitas and severitas; in good prose; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Cic.): si illius (sc. Catonis) comitatem et facilitatem tuae gravitati severitatique asperseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 31, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 10, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 14, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 189</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crassus in summā comitate habebat etiam severitatis satis, Scaevolae multā in severitate non deerat tamen comitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:40:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 40, 148</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in socios, mansuetudo in hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 21, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitas affabilitasque sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:48 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 14, 48 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n9269.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Too great liberality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigality</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comitatensis: <entryFree id="n9270" type="main" key="co^mi^ta_tensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtātensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>comitatus</etym>, <sense id="n9270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the dignity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">office of courtiers</hi> (v. comes, II. D. and E.; <cit><quote lang="la">postclass.): munus, Cod. Th. 12, 1, 38: legio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 36, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabrica, i. e. machinatio,</quote> <trans><tr>a court intrigue</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comitatus: <entryFree id="n9271" type="main" key="co^mi^ta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from comitor and comito; v. comitor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9272" type="main" key="co^mi^ta_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>comes</etym>. <sense id="n9272.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An escort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an attending multitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a train</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retinue</hi> (in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n9272.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum uxore veheretur in raedā muliebri et delicato ancillarum puerorumque comitatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno comitatu ingredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitatum optimorum civium desero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedonis improbissimi societas atque comitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21, § 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 19, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius comitatu equitum triginta ad mare pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:45" default="NO">7, 2, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter modico comitatu ingressus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 98</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 336</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n9272.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">multo ceterarum volucrum comitatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9272.3" n="3" level="3"> Of abstr. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">pruna hordearia appellata a comitatu frugis ejus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>because they ripen at the same time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 13, 12, § 41</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">virgultorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tanto virtutum comitatu (opus est) si? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:1:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 2, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utriusque causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre impetum vitiorum, tam magno comitatu venientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9272.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in the time of the empire, <hi rend="ital">an imperial escort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retinue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:20:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 8:9" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 129" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Osthanes exornatus comitatu Alexandri,</quote> <trans><tr>honored with the right of attendance upon Alexander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 2, § 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deici congressu et comitatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9272.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A company</hi> (without the accessory idea of attendance), <hi rend="ital">a band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swarm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae, quaecumque erant in eo comitatu, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 45, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
comiter: <entryFree id="n9273" type="main" key="co_mi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. comis <sense id="n9273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
comitia: <entryFree id="n9274" type="main" key="co^mi^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. comitium, II.</entryFree>
comitiae: <entryFree id="n9275" type="gloss" key="co^mi^ti^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. comitium, II.</entryFree>
comitialis: <entryFree id="n9276" type="main" key="co^mi^ti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>comitium, II.</etym>, <sense id="n9276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the comitia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>on which the comitia were held</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=29" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 29</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 11, 3</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=38:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 38, 12</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">biduum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <trans><tr>who were always at the comitia</tr>, <tr>and sold their votes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: morbus, <hi rend="ital">the epilepsy</hi> (so called because its occurrence on the day of the comitia, as ominous, broke up the consultation; cf. Fest. s. v. prohibere, p. 234, 28 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called morbus major and sacer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitio corripi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:10:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; and, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtĭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who has the epilepsy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 11, 44, § 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:83" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 7, 23, § 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:33" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 4, 14, § 33</bibl> sq.; 32, 9, 37, § 112.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">epileptically</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by epilepsy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 29, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comitialiter: <entryFree id="n9277" type="main" key="co^mi^ti^a_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtĭālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. comitialis <sense id="n9277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <pb n="375" /> <cb n="COMI" /></sense></entryFree>
comitianus: <entryFree id="n9278" type="main" key="co^mi^ti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n9278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the</hi> Comes Orientis (a court officer), Cod. Th. 8, 4, 18 al.</sense></entryFree>
comitiatus: <entryFree id="n9279" type="main" key="co^mi^ti^a_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtĭātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. comitio <sense id="n9279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9280" type="main" key="co^mi^ti^a_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>comitium, II.</etym>, <sense id="n9280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assembly of the people in the comitia</hi> (very rare), XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 19, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimittere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad comitiatum vocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=91" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 91</bibl></cit> Müll. (al. comitatum, as also in the last passage of Cic.); Messala ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:15:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 15, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comitio: <entryFree id="n9281" type="gloss" key="co^mi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n9281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [comitium]. </sense><sense id="n9281.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go into the comitium</hi>: quando rex comitiavit, fas (abridged, Q. R. C. F.), an old formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=31" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 31</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=278:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 278, 14</bibl> id.; Kalend. Praen. ap. Inscr. Orell. vol. 2, p. 386. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n9281.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtĭātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a military tribune elected at the comitia</hi>, Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Verr. 1:10:30" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Verr. 1, 10, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comitium: <entryFree id="n9282" type="main" key="co^mi^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏm-ĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>locus a coëundo, id est insimul veniendo, est dictus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=38:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 38, 12</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=155" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 155</bibl> id.: comitium ab eo quod coibant eo comitiis curiatis, et litium causā</etym>. <sense id="n9282.0" n="I" level="1"> In <number>sing.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the place for the assembling of the Romans voting by the curiœ</hi> situated near the Forum, and separated from it by the ancient Rostra, but sometimes considered as a part of the Forum in a more extended sense (hence, in Dion.
