Halic. <foreign lang="greek">o( kra/tistos</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">o/ e)pifane/statos th=s a)gora=s to/pos)</foreign>: IN COMITIO AVT IN FORO, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 13, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:35:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 35, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:22:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 22, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:289" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 84, 289</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 36, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 24, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 9</bibl> et saep.; cf. Dict. of Antiq.—</sense><sense id="n9282.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any place of assembly</hi> out of Rome; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the Ephoreum at Sparta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9282.2" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (es) esset animi vestibulum et orationis janua et cogitationum comitium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 7, p. 278, 1</bibl></cit>; so, sacri pectoris, Mam. <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Act. ad Jul. 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9282.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtĭa</orth> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtĭae</orth>, Fratr. Arval. ap. Marin. p. 43; Gloss. Labb. p. 33), <hi rend="ital">the assembly of the Romans for electing magistrates</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">the comitia.</hi>—The comitia were of three kinds. </sense><sense id="n9282.4" n="1" level="3"> Comitia curiata, the most ancient, voting by curiæ, held in the comitium (v. I.), gradually restricted by, </sense><sense id="n9282.5" n="2" level="3"> The Comitia centuriata, the proper assembly of the populus Romanus, voting by centuries, instituted by Servius Tullius, continuing through the whole time of the republic, commonly held in the Campus Martius (not in the comitium, as is asserted by many from the similarity of the name; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">campus, II.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 27, 2</bibl></cit> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52, 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 19, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9282.6" n="3" level="3"> Comitia tributa, voting by tribes, and commonly held in the Forum, but in choosing magistrates, freq. in the Campus Martius, convened for the first time in the trial of Coriolanus, two years after the introduction of the office of tribune of the people. In them the inferior magistrates (ædiles, tribunes of the people, quæstors), and, later, the Pontifex Maximus also, were chosen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:19:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 19, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:58:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 58, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:60:4" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 60, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 27, 3</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Dict. of Antiq.—Upon the comitia calata, v. 1, calo.—The usual t. t. for holding such comitia is: comitia habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:18:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 18, 43</bibl></cit>; freq. in all periods; <cit><quote lang="la">they were designated according to the magistrates who were to be chosen in them, as consularia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:18:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 18, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 22, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 39, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:51:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 51, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: comitia consulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 20, 8</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia fiunt regi creando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicere comitia consulibus creandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 37, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 36, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">differre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 37, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9282.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of other elections</hi>, out of Rome, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:43:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 43, 7</bibl>; Tab. Heracl. v. 24 sq.—</sense><sense id="n9282.8" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibo intro, ubi de capite meo sunt comitia, i. e.,</quote> <trans><tr>where my fate is deciding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pseudulus mihi centuriata capitis habuit comitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo illic nunc sunt capiti comitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comitivus: <entryFree id="n9283" type="main" key="co^mi^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>comes, II. E.</etym>, <sense id="n9283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a chief officer</hi> (post-class.): <cb n="COMM" /> dignitas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 9</bibl>: sedes. Cod. Th. 11, 21, 3; <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <trans><tr>subst</tr>., <tr>a chief</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 33, 3 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
comito: <entryFree id="n9284" type="main" key="co^mi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> collat. form of comitor), <sense id="n9284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to accompany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si Romanae comitarent castra puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:7:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:43" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 259</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 692</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:9:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 9, 47</bibl></cit> (Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 85, 139</bibl>, is, on account of the corruption of the text, dub.).—</sense><sense id="n9284.1" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitor, āri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 55, § 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:2:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 98</bibl>.—Esp. freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">accompanied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attended</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mulier) alienis viris comitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14, 34</bibl></cit>; so with an <case>abl.</case> added, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 441</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 845</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 215</bibl>; 9, 687; 10, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 6, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 38, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trecentis feminarum comitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 309</bibl>. —As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ex urbe parum comitatus exierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 3</bibl>; and hence, also, in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puero ut uno esset comitatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 113</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 37, 52, § 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 1, p. 288, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
comitor: <entryFree id="n9285" type="main" key="co^mi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏmĭtor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n9285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [comes], <hi rend="ital">to join one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to any one as an attendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to accompany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow</hi> (class.; esp. freq. after the Aug. per.); constr. with <case>acc.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with abstr. subjects by Cic. three times (qs. comitem esse) with <case>dat.</case> (v. B. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>). </sense><sense id="n9285.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n9285.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinqui Indutiomari comitati eos ex civitate excesserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nautas fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metellum in exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erilem filium in scholas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gressum erilem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currum Augusti triumpho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem militarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9285.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (esp. freq. in the Aug. poets and Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">lanigerae comitantur oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 660</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:24:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex milia Dalmatarum, recens delectus, comitabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aequo comitantes ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:31" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:10:15:section=16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 10, 15, § 16</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi> of the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the attendance of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attended by</hi>, etc., sometimes to be translated by <hi rend="ital">with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together with</hi>, and with a negative, <hi rend="ital">without</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā comitante catervā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 498</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 11</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 275</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 631</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domino comitante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 402</bibl></cit>: nupsi non comitante deo, <hi rend="ital">without the assent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">against the will of the god</hi> (Hymen), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 3, 16. —</sense><sense id="n9285.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to inanimate objects (cf. comes, I. B.). </sense><sense id="n9285.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitatur fama unionis ejus parem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando comitetur semper artem decor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> C. Mal. Theod. 243</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:126:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 126, § 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9285.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tarquinio Superbo) aliquamdiu prospera fortuna comitata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:24:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 24, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardis enim mentibus virtus non facile comitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera, quae comitantur huic vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 35, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9285.7" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">an est aliquid per se ipsum flagitiosum, etiam si nulla comitetur infamia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Teucrum comitantibus armis Punica se quantis attollet gloria rebus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:865" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 865</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitante opinione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9285.8" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to attend one to the grave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Eumenem) comitante toto exercitu humaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 22, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem exanimum vano honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">supremum comitentur honorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comma: <entryFree id="n9286" type="greek" key="comma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">comma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/mma</foreign>. <sense id="n9286.0" n="I" level="1"> In gram. </sense><sense id="n9286.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A division of a period</hi> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:62:211" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 62, 211</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">66, 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 22</bibl>, written as Greek; <cit><quote lang="la">pure Lat. incisum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 2, p. 460 sq.</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n9286.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mark of punctuation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a comma</hi>, Don. p. 1742 P.—</sense><sense id="n9286.3" n="II" level="1"> In verse, <hi rend="ital">the cœsura</hi>, Marc. Vict. p. 2519 P.</sense></entryFree>
commaceratio: <entryFree id="n9287" type="main" key="comma^ce^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commăcĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>commacero</etym>, <sense id="n9287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dissolution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maceration</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> In Psa. 37, § 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commacero: <entryFree id="n9288" type="main" key="comma^ce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-măcĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to soften by steeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to macerate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in aquā pluviali,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 5, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commacesco: <entryFree id="n9289" type="main" key="comma^cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-măcesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n9289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow lean</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 137, 3</bibl>; cf. macesco.</sense></entryFree>
commaculo: <entryFree id="n9290" type="main" key="comma^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-măcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="COMM" /> <hi rend="ital">spot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pollute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile on all sides</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n9290.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine suo altaria deūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commaculatus sanguine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 6, 164</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9290.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: se isto infinito ambitu, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 7, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se cum Jugurthā miscendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pia templa domosque occursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:752" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 752</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se consortiis aliquorum, Cod. Th. 3, 12, 3: vidnitatem stupri procacitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitiis commaculatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam praeter satellites commaculatos quis eadem volt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 21</bibl></cit> Dietscn.</sense></entryFree>
commadeo: <entryFree id="n9291" type="hapax" key="comma^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mădĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n9291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become very soft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commagene: <entryFree id="n9292" type="main" key="Comma_ge_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Commāgēnē</orth> (in MSS. erroneously <orth extent="full" lang="la">Comāgēnē</orth>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kommaghnh/</foreign>. <sense id="n9292.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The northern province of Syria</hi> (whose chief town was Samosata, now <hi rend="ital">Samosat</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 24, 20, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:55" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 22, 28, § 55</bibl>; 29, 3, 13, § 55; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 1 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9292.1" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Commāgēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Commagene</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:550" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 550</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 7, 9, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">com-māgēnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. medicamentum), <hi rend="ital">a remedy made there</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 13, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:55" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 22, 28, § 55</bibl>; cf. <number>plur.</number> (sc. unguenta), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 21</bibl>.—And <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Commāgēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Commagene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 13, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:42 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 42 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9292.2" n="II" level="1"> (Supply herba.) <hi rend="ital">An unknown plant</hi>, perh. Nardus Syriaca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 13, § 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commalaxo: <entryFree id="n9293" type="hapax" key="comma^laxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mălaxo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make entirely mild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to soften;</hi> trop.: patrem, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 82, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=96" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 96</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
commando: <entryFree id="n9294" type="main" key="commando"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mando</orth>, no <sense id="n9294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to chew</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">frondes myrti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 36, 684</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix commansa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commanducatio: <entryFree id="n9295" type="main" key="commandu_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commandūcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>commanduco</etym>, <sense id="n9295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chewing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mastication</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">olivarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 53" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 53</bibl></cit> and 104.</sense></entryFree>
commanduco: <entryFree id="n9296" type="main" key="commandu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mandūco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), no <sense id="n9296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">commandū-cor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 81, 26</bibl>; p. 123, 27; p. 479, 2 sq.; in trop. signif.), <hi rend="ital">to chew much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chew to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">masticate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">acinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 4, 6, § 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:165" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 13, 105, § 165</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 9" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:53" default="NO">53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:165" default="NO">165</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commaneo: <entryFree id="n9297" type="main" key="comma^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mănĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n9297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remain somewhere constantly</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in domo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 7, 8, 1: aliquo loco, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:20" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 20</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
commanifesto: <entryFree id="n9298" type="main" key="comma^ni^festo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mănĭfesto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to manifest together</hi>, Boeth. Arist. Top. 6, 2, p. 707.</sense></entryFree>
commanipularis: <entryFree id="n9299" type="main" key="comma^ni^pu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mănĭpŭlāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comrade who is in the same</hi> manipulus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3557</bibl>.—So also ‡ <cit><quote lang="la">COMMANIPVLARIVS, ii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Rein.</author> 8, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commanipulatio: <entryFree id="n9300" type="hapax" key="comma^ni^pu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commănĭpŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>commanipulo</etym>, <sense id="n9300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">companionship in a</hi> manipulus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Nig. 10, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commanipulo: <entryFree id="n9301" type="main" key="comma^ni^pu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mănĭpŭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comrade of the same</hi> manipulus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Nig. 10, 5</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">So also ‡ COMMANIPVLVS and COMMANIPLVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3557</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 551, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commarceo: <entryFree id="n9302" type="main" key="commarce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-marcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n9302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n.;</hi> lit., <hi rend="ital">to wither;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to become wholly faint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">31, 12, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commargino: <entryFree id="n9303" type="hapax" key="commargi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-margĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to furnish with a parapet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">railing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commaritus: <entryFree id="n9304" type="hapax" key="comma^ri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mărītus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an associatehusband</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 2, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commartyr: <entryFree id="n9305" type="hapax" key="commarty^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-martyr</orth>, <itype>yris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-martyr</hi>, <hi rend="ital">companion in martyrdom</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commasculo: <entryFree id="n9306" type="main" key="commascu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mascŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>masculus</etym>, <sense id="n9306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make manly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courageous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to invigorate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embolden</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">animum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 124, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commastico: <entryFree id="n9307" type="main" key="commasti^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mastĭco</orth>, no <sense id="n9307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to chew</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0923,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Aem. Mac.</author> 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0923,001:4:8" default="NO">4, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commaticus: <entryFree id="n9308" type="greek" key="comma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kommatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n9308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">hymnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhythmi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. 23, 450</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commaturesco: <entryFree id="n9309" type="main" key="comma_tu_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mātūresco</orth>, <itype>rŭi, ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n9309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ripen thoroughly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi commaturuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 49, 7</bibl></cit> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
commeabilis: <entryFree id="n9310" type="main" key="comme^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĕābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (perh. only in Arn.). <sense id="n9310.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is casily passed through</hi>, <pb n="376" /> <cb n="COMM" /> <hi rend="ital">permeable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 84, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9310.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that easily passes through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 233</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commeatalis: <entryFree id="n9311" type="main" key="comme^a_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commĕātālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>commeatus</etym>, <sense id="n9311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to provisions</hi> or <hi rend="ital">supplies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">formula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <trans><tr>accompanying the provisions</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 27, 2, § 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 38, 16, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commeator: <entryFree id="n9312" type="main" key="comme^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commĕātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>commeo</etym>, <sense id="n9312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who goes to and fro</hi>, an epithet of Mercury as messenger of the gods to men, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 262</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 315, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commeatus: <entryFree id="n9313" type="main" key="comme^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commĕātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n9313.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A going to and fro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passing freely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">going at will</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo conclavid ego perfodi parietem, Quā conmeatus clam esset hinc huc mulieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatum vocis exercent fauces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9313.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9313.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A place through which one can pass back and forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a thoroughfare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi> (rare; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">abitus, aditus, circuitus, etc.): nimis beat, quod conmeatus transtinet trans parietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per hortum utroque conmeatus continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:8:2:section=25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 8, 2, § 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9313.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A leave of absence from one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s station for a definite time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a furlough</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeare, ultro citro ire: unde commeatus dari dicitur, id est tempus, quo ire, redire quis posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=277:27" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 277, 27</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">dare commeatum totius aestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 46, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 46, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commeatu esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be on furlough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatu abesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:6:35:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 6, 35, § 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in iis stativis satis liberi commeatus erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(legiones) promiscuis militum commeatibus infirmaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum miles ad commeatus diem non adfuit,</quote> <trans><tr>on the day when the furlough expired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 14, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatūs spatium excedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra commeatum abesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:1:2:section=6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 1, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras igitur (sc. proficiscar), nisi quid a te commeatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> dub. (al. commeat); v. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longum mihi commeatum dederat mala valetudo,</quote> <trans><tr>rest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 54:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 54, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitus assidua... sine intervallo, sine commeatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 3</bibl></cit>, praef. § 16.—</sense><sense id="n9313.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A train</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a convoy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caravan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a company carried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a transportation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Londinium copiā negotiatorum et commeatuum maxime celebre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duobus commeatibus exercitum reportare instituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 23</bibl></cit>: secundum commeatum in Africam mittit ad Caesarem, Auct. B. Afr. 34: commeatibus per municipia ac colonias dispositis, <hi rend="ital">supplies of provisions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relays of horses</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerneres canes... per omnem nostrum commeatum morsibus ambulare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 209, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9313.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Provisions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplies</hi> (very freq., esp. in the histt., in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): interclude inimicis commeatum; <cit><quote lang="la">tibi muni viam, Quā cibatus commeatusque ad te et legiones tuas Tuto possit pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:70 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 70 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">importare in coloniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex omnibus provinciis commeatu et publico et privato prohibebamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:17:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 17, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne foro quidem et commeatu juvare populum Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatu nostros prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque exercitum sine magno commeatu atque molimento in unum locum contrahere posse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 54, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex montibus invecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 14, 3 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni commeatus frumenti Romam subvecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9313.6" n="2" level="3"> Freq. opp. frumentum, <hi rend="ital">the remaining supplies of war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Vesontionem rei frumentariae commeatūsque causā moratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti frumento commeatuque Caesarem intercluderet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; 3, 6; 3, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 70</bibl> supra.—* </sense><sense id="n9313.7" n="E" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatus argentarius,</quote> <trans><tr>gain acquired by money transactions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commeditor: <entryFree id="n9314" type="hapax" key="comme^di^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĕdĭtor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n9314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to impress carefully on one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to practise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imitate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus chartarum,</quote> <trans><tr>sounds like</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 112</bibl></cit> Munro ad loc. (but <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 18, 31</bibl> B. and K. read commode notare).</sense></entryFree>
commejo: <entryFree id="n9315" type="gloss" key="comme_jo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commējo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">katourw=</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.: <sense id="n9315.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">lectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 5, p. 261</bibl></cit> P. <cb n="COMM" /></sense></entryFree>
commeleto: <entryFree id="n9316" type="greek" key="comme^le^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĕlĕto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>vox hybrida, from com-<foreign lang="greek">meleta/w</foreign>; pure Lat. commeditor</etym>, <sense id="n9316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to praclise assiduously</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 165" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 165</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commembratus: <entryFree id="n9317" type="hapax" key="commembra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-membrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>membro</etym>, <sense id="n9317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grown up together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">united;</hi> only trop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 44, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commemini: <entryFree id="n9318" type="main" key="comme^mi^ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĕmĭni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>isse</itype>, <sense id="n9318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. defect.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recollect a thing in all its particulars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remember</hi> (in Plaut. several times; elsewh. rare). </sense><sense id="n9318.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc conmemini magis, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 98</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 16</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> of quantity: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: quem hominem probe commeminisse se aiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 227</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ego autem non commemini antequam sum natus, me miserum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9318.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non conmemini dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 15</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9318.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n9318.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conmeminit domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">memini et scio et calleo et conmemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:792" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 792</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9318.5" n="II" level="1"> In speech, <hi rend="ital">to recall to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mention</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Plato complurium Socratis sectatorum in sermonibus, quos scripsit, commeminit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:3:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commemorabilis: <entryFree id="n9319" type="main" key="comme^mo^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commĕmŏrābĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>commemoro</etym>, <sense id="n9319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worth mentioning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">memorable</hi> (rare): clara et conmemorabilis pugna, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa commemorabilia proferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commemoramentum: <entryFree id="n9320" type="main" key="comme^mo^ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commĕmŏrāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reminding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mentioning</hi> (ante- and post-class. for the class. commemoratio): stupri, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 84, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremum artis suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, 2, p. 374" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, 2, p. 374</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commemoratio: <entryFree id="n9321" type="main" key="comme^mo^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commĕmŏrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calling to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reminding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suggesting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commemorating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remembrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mentioning</hi> (several times in Cic. and Quint.; elsewh. rare): istaec commemoratio Quasi exprobratio est immemoris benefici, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 16</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">obj.-gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 34, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei gestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequens illorum, quae egerat in senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Verres) in assiduā commemoratione omnibus flagitiorum fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>every one was continually recounting his crimes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 39</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">101: tuae virtutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 1, 12, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commemoratione hominum delectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:55:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 55, § 123</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj. -gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteritatis,</quote> <trans><tr>by posterity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid suā commemoratione celebrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 40, 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commemorator: <entryFree id="n9322" type="hapax" key="comme^mo^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commĕmŏrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who mentions a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a commemorator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commemoratorium: <entryFree id="n9323" type="hapax" key="comme^mo^ra_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commĕmŏrātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of remembrance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calliditatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Off. 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commemoratus: <entryFree id="n9324" type="spur" key="comme^mo^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commĕmŏrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, a false read. for commemoratum, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1</bibl>, n. 16.</entryFree>
commemoro: <entryFree id="n9325" type="main" key="comme^mo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĕmŏro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to recall an object to memory in all its particulars.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9325.1" n="I" level="1"> Rarely of one's self, <hi rend="ital">to call to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be mindful of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep in mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remember;</hi> with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rel. -clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid quoque die dixerim, audierim, egerim, commemoro vesperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 11, 38</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidie commemorabam te unum in tanto exercitu mihi fuisse adsensorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitandi rumoris causā, quo patrem Caesarem vulgo reprehensum commemorabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n9325.2" n="II" level="1"> Of others, <hi rend="ital">to bring something to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s recollection by speaking of it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remind of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad commemorandam renovandamque amicitiam missi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia meminisse debet is, in quem collata sunt, non commemorare qui contulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 71</bibl></cit>.—Hence (and so most freq.), </sense><sense id="n9325.3" n="B" level="2"> Without the access. idea of remembering, <hi rend="ital">to make mention of something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to recount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate;</hi> constr. with <case>acc.</case>, <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rel.clause</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">de.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9325.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id interdum furtim nomen commemorabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:938" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 938</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanam societatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Xenophontis illam jucunditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o commemoranda judicia!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 14, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 18</bibl>.— <cb n="COMM" /> </sense><sense id="n9325.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 160</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9325.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego nunc commemorem Singillatim, qualis ego in hunc fuerim?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">chlamydem hanc commemores quanti conducta'st?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9325.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes de tuā virtute commemorant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:13:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 13, § 37</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:20:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 20, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 14, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 6:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 6, 2 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multa de aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 17, 1</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si in privatis gloriosa sunt, multo magis commemorabuntur in regibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 14, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: cum legent in ejus virtutibus commemorari saltasse eum commode, Nep. praef. § 1.</sense></entryFree>
commendabilis: <entryFree id="n9326" type="main" key="commenda_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commendābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>commendo</etym>, <sense id="n9326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy of praise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commendable</hi> (rare; perh. not ante-Aug.); with <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbustum fructu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:37" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 9, 18, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aviculae cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 7, 15</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, Treb. XXX. Tyrann. 16.</sense></entryFree>
commendaticius: <entryFree id="n9327" type="main" key="commenda_ti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commendātĭcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>commendatio</etym>, <sense id="n9327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving for commendation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commendatory</hi> (very rare): litterae, <hi rend="ital">letters of recommendation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">introduction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 5, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:65" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 65</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tabellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 148</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <itype>commendaticiae, ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Macr. S. 2:4:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Macr. S. 2, 4, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commendatio: <entryFree id="n9328" type="main" key="commenda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commendātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>commendo</etym>, <sense id="n9328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a commendation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recommending</hi> (in good prose, and very freq.). </sense><sense id="n9328.1" n="I" level="1"> In abstr., as an act: <cit><quote lang="la">amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 26</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ter;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 59</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:17" default="NO">4, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:46 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 46 al.</bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 32, 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ceteros contempti hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36, 124</bibl></cit> (opp. offensio adversarii); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:4:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 4, § 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commendationes morientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. commendo, I. B. 2.—</sense><sense id="n9328.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, by the eyes: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 13, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9328.3" n="II" level="1"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">that which recommends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the excellence of a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a recommendation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:238" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 52, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumosarum imaginum (i. e. nobilitatis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta (erat) oris atque orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae atque aetatis, Auct. B. Alex. 41: animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:113" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:154" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima commendatio proficiscitur a modestiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 13, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 45; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurus, cum in primā commendatione voluptatem dixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 12, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 14, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commendatitius: <entryFree id="n9329" type="main" key="commenda_ti^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commendātĭtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. commendaticius.</entryFree>
commendativus: <entryFree id="n9330" type="main" key="commenda_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commendātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>commendo</etym>, <sense id="n9330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">commendatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus, i. e. dativus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 670</bibl></cit> Putsch.</sense></entryFree>
commendator: <entryFree id="n9331" type="main" key="commenda_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commendātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who commends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a commender</hi> (in post-Aug. prose; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, however, commendatrix): fautor et commendator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 23, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:40 al" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 40 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
commendatorius: <entryFree id="n9332" type="main" key="commenda_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commendātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>commendator</etym>, <sense id="n9332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving for commendation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commendatory</hi> (for the class. commendaticius): <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 10</bibl></cit>; Jul. Epit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:6:section=26" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> 6, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commendatrix: <entryFree id="n9333" type="main" key="commenda_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commendātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which commends</hi> (rare): legem commendatricem virtutum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:22:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 22, 58</bibl>: terra, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commendatus: <entryFree id="n9334" type="main" key="commenda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commendātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>commendo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
commendo: <entryFree id="n9335" type="main" key="commendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mendo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. mando</etym>, <sense id="n9335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to commit to one for preservation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to intrust to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commit to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commend to</hi>. </sense><sense id="n9335.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9335.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, implying a physical delivery, <hi rend="ital">to deposit with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrust to;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquid alicui</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commendare nihil aliud est quam deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:186" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oratorem meum—sic enim inscripsi— Sabino tuo commendavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum sacrove commendatum qui clepsit rapsitve parricida esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummos alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus alicui loco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">CORPORA SARCOPHAGO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4370</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina sulcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:541" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 541</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">apud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <case>acc.</case> (rare and post-class.): Demetrius duos filios apud Gnidium hospitem suum cum magno auri pondere commendaverat, <pb n="377" /> <cb n="COMM" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 35, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus beneficio ad sororem Medeam est commendatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 3" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9335.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me tuae commendo et committo fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 47</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bona nostra haec tibi permitto et tuae mando fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 5, 61</bibl></cit>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">commendare se patri in clientelam et fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi ejus omnia negotia, libertos, procuratores, familiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos sum testatus, vobis me ac meos commendavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:57:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 57, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum me tuo amori fideique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi suos testamento liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul atque natum sit animal, ipsum sibi conciliari et commendari ad se conservandum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 495</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem diis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rempublicam patribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 90</bibl></cit>;
