<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: aliquid litteris, <hi rend="ital">to commit to writing</hi>, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">historiam immortalitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen tuum immortalitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen suum posteritati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum sempiternae gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: se fugae, Auct. B. Afr. 34.—</sense><sense id="n9335.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of the dying, <hi rend="ital">to commend</hi> children, parents, etc., to the care of others: <cit><quote lang="la">is, qui morti addictus esset, paucos sibi dies commendandorum suorum causā postulavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 10, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi de suā salute desperantes ... parentes suos commendabant, si quos ex eo periculo fortuna servare potuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille tibi moriens nos commendavit senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 11, 73: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi suos testamento liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9335.5" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to commend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">recommend</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to procure favor for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set off with advantage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grace</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">principes undique convenire et se civitatesque suas Caesari commendare coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. G. 8, 50: P. Rutilii adulescentiam ad opinionem et conscientiae et juris scientiae P. Mucii commendavit domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vox) quae una maxime eloquentiam vel commendat vel sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 252</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā re unā magis oratorem commendari quam verborum splendore et copiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:59:216" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 59, 216</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectus nemo historicorum commendavit magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod me Lucanae commendet amicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmora commendantur maculis aut coloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 8, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compluresque tribuni militum ad Caesarem veniunt seque ei commendant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc idcirco commemoratum a te puto, uti te infimo ordini commendares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se civibus impiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se numeris commendat et arte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se tonsā cute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his factis abunde se posteritati commendasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1</bibl></cit>, ext. 2.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">commendātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n9335.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Commended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recommended to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res gloriosior? quae commendatior erit memoriae hominum sempiternae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 18, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteris rebus habeas eos a me commendatissimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 26, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 10, 2</bibl>; 13, 64, 1.—</sense><sense id="n9335.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valued</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus commendatior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 110, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 65, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama commendatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 10, 81, § 130</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commensurabilis: <entryFree id="n9336" type="main" key="commensu_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commensūrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mensuro</etym>, <sense id="n9336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a common measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commensurable</hi>, Boëth. 1 Arithm. 18, p. 1000 al.</sense></entryFree>
commensuratio: <entryFree id="n9337" type="main" key="commensu_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commensūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">symmetry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uniformity</hi>, Boëth. Arist. Top. 2, 1, p. 680.</sense></entryFree>
commensuratus: <entryFree id="n9338" type="main" key="commensu_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commensūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">equal</hi>: consonantiae, Boëth. 1 Mus. 29, p. 1084.</sense></entryFree>
commensus: <entryFree id="n9339" type="main" key="commensus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. commetior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9340" type="main" key="commensus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commensus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>commetior</etym>, <sense id="n9340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a due proportion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">symmetry</hi> (a word of Vitr., as transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">summetri/a</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6</bibl> praef.; 6, 2.</sense></entryFree>
commentariensis: <entryFree id="n9341" type="main" key="commenta_ri^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commentārĭensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>commentarius</etym>, <sense id="n9341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who takes control</hi>, <hi rend="ital">has the care of a thing;</hi> and specif., </sense><sense id="n9341.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A registrar of public documents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a recorder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:45:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 45, § 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 27, 1, § 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9341.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who makes out a list of prisoners</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a keeper of a prison</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 9, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:20:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 20, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:3:8" default="NO">48, 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9341.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who forms a list of soldiers</hi>, Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Verr. 2:1:28:section=71" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Verr. 2, 1, 28, § 71</bibl>. <cb n="COMM" /></sense></entryFree>
commentariolum: <entryFree id="n9342" type="main" key="commenta_ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commentārĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-lus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 149, 1</bibl>), <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>commentarius</etym>, <sense id="n9342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short treatise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brief commentary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 14" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of dub. form,</quote> <trans><tr>abl. plur</tr>.,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commentarius: <entryFree id="n9343" type="main" key="commenta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commentārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. liber; <sense id="n9343.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">both together,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 17</bibl></cit>); <orth extent="full" lang="la">commentā-rĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. volumen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=90" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 90</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:44:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 44, 164</bibl>; cf. commentariolum) [commentor]. </sense><sense id="n9343.1" n="I" level="1"> Orig. <hi rend="ital">a note-book</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sketch-book</hi>, <hi rend="ital">memorandum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diurni,</quote> <trans><tr>a journal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9343.2" n="II" level="1"> As the title of a book on any subject, but esp. historical, which is only sketched down or written without care (mostly in <number>plur.</number>), <hi rend="ital">a sketch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a paper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">memoirs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a commentary</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:58" default="NO">3, 8, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:67" default="NO">3, 8, 67</bibl>; 8, 2, 12; 10, 7, 30 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl> et saep. Thus the two works of Cæsar upon the Gallic and civil wars are called Commentarii, <hi rend="ital">commentaries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:262" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 262</bibl>; Hirt. and Asin. Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl>.—Of a single book: <cit><quote lang="la">superiore commentario,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the Seventh Book</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:30" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 145</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9343.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n9343.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A commentary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brief explanation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annotation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentarium in Vergilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:21" default="NO">1, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9343.5" n="2" level="3"> In law, <hi rend="ital">a brief</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21, § 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9343.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The day-book of an accounting officer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 592, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2904</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9343.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A collection of examples</hi> or <hi rend="ital">citations</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9343.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pupil</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s notes of a lecture</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lesson</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commentatio: <entryFree id="n9344" type="main" key="commenta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n9344.0" n="I" level="1"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">a diligent meditation upon something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a studying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a careful preparation</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">mele/th</foreign> (so perh. only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">loci multa commentatione atque meditatione parati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 118</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 257</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:71:249" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 71, 249</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentatio inclusa in veritatis lucem proferenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 157</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n9344.1" n="2" level="3"> As rhet. fig., = <foreign lang="greek">e)nqu/mhma</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9344.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota philosophorum vita, ut ait idem (Socrates), commentatio mortis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 74</bibl></cit> (transl. of Plat. Phaed. § 12: <foreign lang="greek">*to\ mele/thma au)to\ tou=to/ e)sti tw=n filoso/fwn, lu/sis kai\ xwrismo\s *yuxh=s a)po\ sw/matos</foreign>), commentatio ferendi doloris, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9344.3" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a learned work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treatise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissertation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">description</hi> (so perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">commentatio (de naturā animalium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 44</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Indiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 60</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 2, § 7</bibl>; Gell. praef. § 4.</sense></entryFree>
commentator: <entryFree id="n9345" type="main" key="commenta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commentātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. commentor</etym>. <sense id="n9345.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An inventor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contriver</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">omnium falsorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 321, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evangelii,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the author</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res Carn. 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9345.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An interpreter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 17, 2, § 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 6, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commenticius: <entryFree id="n9346" type="main" key="commenti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commentĭcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <etym>commentus, comminiscor</etym>, <sense id="n9346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thought out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fabricated</hi> (most freq. in Cicero). </sense><sense id="n9346.1" n="I" level="1"> Opp. to that already existing, <hi rend="ital">invented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">new</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominibus novis et commenticiis appellata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectacula (opp. usitata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 20</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n9346.2" n="II" level="1"> Opp. to that which is actual. </sense><sense id="n9346.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">feigned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ideal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imaginary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas Platonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commenticii et ficti di,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9346.4" n="B" level="2"> In opp. to moral reality, truth, <hi rend="ital">fabricated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feigned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">false</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 29, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 9, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae, Cod. Th. 7, 18, 11, § 1: jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:48:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 48, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commentior: <entryFree id="n9347" type="main" key="commenti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mentĭor</orth>, <itype>ītus, 4</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n9347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to invent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">devise a falsehood</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 314, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 50, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se virum bonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 7, p. 188, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commento: <entryFree id="n9348" type="main" key="commento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commento</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n9348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. act.</hi>, collat. form of 1. commentor, q. v. (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P.), <hi rend="ital">to delineate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sketch;</hi> only trop.: ora, humorously, qs. <hi rend="ital">to demonstrate on the face</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">to cudgel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 30</bibl> dub. (Brix, commetavi; cf. 2. commeto).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9348.1" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">commentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sua et commentata et scripta... meminisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:88:301" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 88, 301</bibl></cit> (just before: secum commentatus in <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> signif.): oratio, Q. Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 26, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commentor: <entryFree id="n9349" type="main" key="commentor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commentor</orth>, <itype>ātus sum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n9349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. dep.</hi> [comminiscor]. </sense><sense id="n9349.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to consider</hi> <cb n="COMM" /> <hi rend="ital">thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meditate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">study</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliberate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi> mentally, etc. (class.). </sense><sense id="n9349.2" n="A" level="2"> Ingen. </sense><sense id="n9349.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cito commentatus est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>has made up a story</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in hortos D. Bruti auguris commentandi causā convenissemus,</quote> <trans><tr>deliberation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magi, qui congregantur in fano commentandi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 41, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9349.4" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ipsum, qui multos annos nihil aliud commentaris, docebo quid sit humaniter vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentari aliquid et discere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: futuras mecum commentabar miserias, id. poët. Tusc. 3, 14, 29.—</sense><sense id="n9349.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">interrog. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut commentemur inter nos, quā ratione nobis traducendum sit hoc tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9349.6" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos mensis de populi Romani libertate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 14, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9349.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n9349.8" n="1" level="3"> Of the orator's preparation for a speech (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n9349.9" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quem paratus venerat, cum in villā Metelli compluris dies commentatus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: itaque videas barbato rostro eum commentari, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 455, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebro digitorum labrorumque motu commentari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9349.10" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quae secum commentatus esset, ea sine scripto redderet eisdem verbis quibus cogitasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:88:301" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 88, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mihi iste visus est ex aliā oratione declamare, quam in alium reum commentaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9349.11" n="2" level="3"> Of writings, <hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi> as the result of study, <hi rend="ital">write</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quorum alter commentatus est mimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo ipso anno cum commentaremur haec,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 209</bibl></cit>: Cato de militari disciplinā commentans, id. praef. § 30.— With <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to discuss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">write upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque commentari quae audierat fas erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina legendo commentando, que etiam ceteris nota facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9349.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9349.13" n="A" level="2"> Of the oratorical student's practice in speaking (always with reference to the mental exertion and preparation; cf. Jan. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 22, 87</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">commentabar declamitans, sic enim nunc loquuntur, saepe cum M. Pisone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:310" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 90, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exisse eo colore et eis oculis, ut egisse causam, non commentatum putares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 87</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magister hic Samnitium summā jam senectute est et cottidie commentatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:23:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 23, 86</bibl></cit> Sorof ad loc.— </sense><sense id="n9349.14" n="B" level="2"> Hence, as a modest expression for a speaker's effort, <hi rend="ital">to experiment in speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attempt to speak</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satisne vobis videor pro meo jure in vestris auribus commentatus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:25:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 25, 75</bibl></cit> Orell. and Madv. ad loc.— </sense><sense id="n9349.15" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To imitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adopt the language of</hi> another: <cit><quote lang="la">Achilem Aristarchi mihi commentari lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9349.16" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To meditate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cogitaras id, quod illa tropaea plena dedecoris et risūs te commentatum esse declarant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40, 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9350" type="main" key="commentor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commentor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>comminiscor</etym>, <sense id="n9350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who devises</hi> or <hi rend="ital">invents something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inventor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae, i. e. Bacchus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:785" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 785</bibl></cit>: fraudis, Auct. Ep. Iliad. 579: machinarius, <hi rend="ital">a machinist</hi>, Scl. 5, § 13 Momms. (al. commentator).</sense></entryFree>
commentum: <entryFree id="n9351" type="main" key="commentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. comminiscor <sense id="n9351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
commentus: <entryFree id="n9352" type="main" key="commentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from comminiscor.</entryFree>
commeo: <entryFree id="n9353" type="main" key="comme^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n9353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go and come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass to and fro</hi>: remeare redire, ut commeare ultro citroque ire, unde commeatus (leave of absence; <cit><quote lang="la">v. commeatus, II. B.) dari dicitur, id est tempus, quo ire et redire commode quis possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=276:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 276, 5</bibl></cit>, and p. 277, 25.—Hence freq. with <hi rend="ital">ultro</hi> and <hi rend="ital">citro</hi> (in good prose; freq. in Cic. and the histt.; not in Quint.). </sense><sense id="n9353.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n9353.2" n="A" level="2"> Usu. of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">pisciculi ultro ac citro commeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 30, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 38, 38, § 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum terra in aquam se vertit et cum ex aquā oritur aër, ex aëre aether, cumque eadem vicissim retro commeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tuto ab repentino hostium incursu etiam singuli commeare possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Veios Romamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commeantibus invicem nuntiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā viā omnes commeabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 32, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 7, 6</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9353.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. objects: alterum (genus siderum) spatiis inmutabilibus ab ortu ad occasum commeans. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl>: (fossam) latitudinis, <pb n="378" /> <cb n="COMM" /> quā contrariae quinqueremes commearent, <hi rend="ital">pass to and fro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:18:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 18, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigae inter se occurrentes, sine periculo commeare dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum a summo ore in pulmonem, atque inde sursum in os commeare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:11:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi> commeatur, <hi rend="ital">we</hi>, <hi rend="ital">they</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">go</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:8:2:section=21 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 8, 2, § 21 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9353.4" n="C" level="2"> Rarely with <hi rend="ital">cognate acc.</hi> vias, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:27:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10, 27, § 2</bibl> (for <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:82, v. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 82, v. 1</bibl>. commeto).—</sense><sense id="n9353.5" n="II" level="1"> With particular reference to the terminus ad quem, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">travel somewhere repeatedly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frequently; to visit a place often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to frequent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula Delos, quo omnes undique cum mercibus commeabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 18, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9353.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to inanim. or abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">nam illaec catapultae ad me crebro commeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus in hortos, domum, Baias jure suo libidines omnium commearent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebro illius litterae ab aliis ad nos commeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commercator: <entryFree id="n9354" type="gloss" key="commerca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commercātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">sune/mporos</foreign>, <sense id="n9354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-trader</hi>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
commerciarius: <entryFree id="n9355" type="gloss" key="commerci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commercĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">sunwnhth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n9355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-purchaser</hi>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
commercior: <entryFree id="n9356" type="main" key="commerci^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commercĭor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>commercium</etym>, <sense id="n9356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to trade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commerciandi licentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commercium: <entryFree id="n9357" type="main" key="commerci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mercĭum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">con-m-</orth>; ante-class.; sometimes ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">commircĭum</orth>; cf. Vel. Long. p. 2236 P.), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>merx</etym>. <sense id="n9357.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Commercial intercourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traffic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commerce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare magnum et ignara lingua commercia prohibebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:29" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 52, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 29, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commercium hominum in locum aliquem mutui usus contrahunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 18, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque Thraces commercio faciles erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:58:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 58, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus commercii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:5:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9357.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9357.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The right to trade as merchants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mercantile right</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commercium in eo agro nemini est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:40:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 40, § 93</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 50</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">124: L. Crasso commercium istarum rerum cum Graecis hominibus non fuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 59</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">133: ceteris Latinis populis conubia commerciaque et concilia inter se ademerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 5, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:62" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:39" default="NO">30, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:34" default="NO">45, 1, 34</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n9357.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An article of traffic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merchandise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wares</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commercia militaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 13, 47, § 168</bibl></cit>; for <hi rend="ital">provisions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 4, 9, § 18</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 2, 5, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9357.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A place of trade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">market - place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commercia et litora peragrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 11, § 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9357.5" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">intercourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">communication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correspondence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fellowship;</hi> lit. and trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi mecum est commerci, senex?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi cum vostris legibus Nihil est commerci,</quote> <trans><tr>I have nothing to do with your laws</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commercium habere cum Musis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commercium habere cum virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dandi et excipiendi beneficii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum aedificiorumque inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 29, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebis,</quote> <trans><tr>with them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:16" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 24, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 36, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 33, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">loquendi audiendique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commercia epistularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:65:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 65, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc inter nos epistularum commercium frequentare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 38:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communium studiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortis humanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <trans><tr>stipulation</tr>, <tr>treaty</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 532</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">belli dirimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 81</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est deus in nobis, et sunt commercia caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 549</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9357.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">forbidden intercourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illicit commerce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:2:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 36</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eā mihi fuit commercium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9357.7" n="2" level="3"> In law, = collusio, Cod. Th. 3, 11, 4; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 4, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
commercor: <entryFree id="n9358" type="main" key="commercor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mercor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">con-m-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n9358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to trade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traffic together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buy up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchase</hi> (except in Sall., only ante - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">captivos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives, homines liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma, tela, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">commercātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: edulia, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 28, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commereo: <entryFree id="n9359" type="main" key="comme^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĕrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to merit fully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deserve something;</hi> usu. in a bad <cb n="COMM" /> sense. </sense><sense id="n9359.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogabatur reus, quam quasi aestimationem commeruisse se maxime confiteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam sciens commerui merito ut caperet odium illam mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9359.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (with culpam, etc.; antecedens pro consequenti; prop. to earn, acquire, bring to or upon one's self), <hi rend="ital">to err in something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to commit an offence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be guilty of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetrate</hi> (mostly ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">noxiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem Castigare pro conmeritā noxiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego de te conmerui mali?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque te conmeruisse culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 43</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commerere in se aliquid mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid commerui aut peccavi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 112</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid placidae commeruistis oves?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:362" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 362</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commereor: <entryFree id="n9360" type="main" key="commere^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commerĕor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>ĭtus sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (ante- and post-class. collat. form of commereo). <sense id="n9360.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To commit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be guilty of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me culpam conmeritum scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae numquam quicquam erga me conmerita'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9360.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To earn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merit</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fidem sedulitatis et veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus et sacrificia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commetacula: <entryFree id="n9361" type="gloss" key="commetacu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commetacŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n9361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rods carried by the flamens</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=64:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 64, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=56:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 56, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commetior: <entryFree id="n9362" type="main" key="comme_ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mētĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">con-m-</orth>), <itype>mensus, 4</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n9362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to measure</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes porticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siderum ambitus inter se numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 9</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n9362.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to measure with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to proportion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium cum tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commeto: <entryFree id="n9363" type="main" key="comme_to1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commēto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conm-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n9363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [commeo, II.], <hi rend="ital">to go frequently</hi>, Afran. and Novius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 89, 30 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mulierculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 35</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> of distance: <cit><quote lang="la">nam meus scruposam victus conmetat viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9364" type="hapax" key="comme_to2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mēto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">con-m-</orth>), <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <sense id="n9364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a.; to measure thoroughly;</hi> comice: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis bene ora commetavi atque ex meā sententiā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with my fists</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 30</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc. (al. commentavi).</sense></entryFree>
commictilis: <entryFree id="n9365" type="hapax" key="commicti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commictĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>commingo</etym>, <sense id="n9365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that deserves to be defiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despicable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vile</hi>: servi, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 83, 5</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 138 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
commictus: <entryFree id="n9366" type="main" key="commictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from commingo.</entryFree>
commigratio: <entryFree id="n9367" type="main" key="commi_^gra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commī^grātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>commigro</etym>, <sense id="n9367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wandering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">migration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(siderum) aliunde alio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 6:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 6, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commigro: <entryFree id="n9368" type="main" key="commi_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mī^gro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">con-m-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n9368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remove somewhere with all one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s effects</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to migrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter</hi> (rare, but in good prose; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. after the Aug. per.): huc habitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc viciniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: in tuam (domum), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53:7" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 53, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antium, deinde Alexandriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e Germaniā in Gallias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commiles: <entryFree id="n9369" type="gloss" key="commi_le^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mīlĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-soldier</hi> (for the class. commilito), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 819, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commilitium: <entryFree id="n9370" type="main" key="commi_li^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mīlĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>militia</etym>, <sense id="n9370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">companionship in war</hi> (prob. not in use before the Aug. period). </sense><sense id="n9370.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., Veil. 2, 29, 5; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:111" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:10:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:3" default="NO">11, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 18, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9370.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fellowship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">companionship</hi> in gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">(studiorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:5:72" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 5, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 356, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 780</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commilito: <entryFree id="n9371" type="main" key="commi_li^to1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mīlĭto</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n9371.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A comrade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">companion in war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fellow-soldier</hi> (in good prose; most freq. in the histt., esp. of the post-Aug. per.), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 10, 28</bibl>; Caesar ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 67</bibl>; August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25</bibl>; C. Cassius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 5</bibl> and 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:59:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 59, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:20:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 20, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n9371.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a comrade</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carissimus sibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:11:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; and for <hi rend="ital">a prostitute</hi>, Elag. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9372" type="main" key="commi_li^to2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mīlĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n9372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be a companion in war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fight in company;</hi> only fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">luna quasi commilitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:23" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comminabundus: <entryFree id="n9373" type="hapax" key="commi^na_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commĭnābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>comminor</etym>,<cb n="COMM" />  <sense id="n9373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">threatening</hi> (with <case>dat.</case>): <cit><quote lang="la">comminabundus nobilibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comminatio: <entryFree id="n9374" type="main" key="commi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a threatening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">menacing</hi> (rare, but in good prose): orationis tamquam armorum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 206</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 33</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">taurorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 181</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:7:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 7, § 7</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: imperiosae, Tiro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comminativus: <entryFree id="n9375" type="hapax" key="commi^na_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commĭnātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">threatening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">menacing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comminator: <entryFree id="n9376" type="hapax" key="commi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a threatener</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commingo: <entryFree id="n9377" type="main" key="commingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mingo</orth>, <itype>minxi, minctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pollute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>: lectum potus (by vomiting), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavia comminxit spurcā salivā tuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:78:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 78, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:99:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 99, 10</bibl>: commictum caenum, as a term of reproach, for <hi rend="ital">a paltry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirty fellow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commictum caeno stercilinium publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comminiscor: <entryFree id="n9378" type="main" key="commi^niscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĭniscor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">con-m-</orth>), <itype>mentus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n9378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. dep.</hi> [miniscor, whence also reminiscor, stem men, whence mens, memini; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=44" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 44</bibl>] (lit. to ponder carefully, to reflect upon; hence, as a result of reflection; cf. 1. commentor, II.), <hi rend="ital">to devise something by careful thought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to contrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feign.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9378.1" n="I" level="1"> (Class., of something untrue; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Plaut.) Reperi, comminiscere, cedo calidum consilium cito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabricare quidvis, quidvis comminiscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolum docte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid agam? aut quid comminiscar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec me hoc commentum putes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: tantum scelus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 30</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">relative - clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quo pacto celem probrum queo comminisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac Amphitruonem ab aedibus Ut abigas quovis pacto commentus sies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit> (cf. <itype>infra</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>).—</sense><sense id="n9378.2" n="B" level="2"> Of philosophic fiction (cf. commenticius), as antith. to actual, real: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurus monogrammos deos et nihil agentes commentus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 59</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">occurrentia nescio quae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:16:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9378.3" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil adversus tale machinationis genus parare aut comminisci oppidani conabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id vectigal commentum alterum ex censoribus satis credebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novas litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum balinearum usum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:27" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoenices, litteras et litterarum operas, aliasque etiam artes, maria navibus adire, classe confligere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:12:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excubias nocturnas vigilesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl>. !*? </sense><sense id="n9378.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">commentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">devised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feigned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrived</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fictitious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dat gemitus fictos commentaque funera narrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:558" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 558</bibl></cit>; 4, 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 319</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9378.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">commentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n9378.6" n="A" level="2"> (Class.) <hi rend="ital">An invention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fabrication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falsehood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsis commentum placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionum commenta delet dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit> (cf. just before: <cit><quote lang="la">opiniones fictas atque vanas): non sine aliquo commento miraculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mixta rumorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9378.7" n="B" level="2"> Since the Aug. per., sometimes, <hi rend="ital">a contrivance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 37, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:4:3 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 4, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9378.8" n="C" level="2"> Nefanda, <hi rend="ital">a project</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:4:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">callidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:9:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 9, 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9378.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A stratagem</hi>, in war, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n9378.10" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A rhetorical figure</hi>, equiv. to commentatio, = <foreign lang="greek">e)nqu/mhma</foreign>, Vitellius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:107" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 107</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 5:10:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commino: <entryFree id="n9379" type="hapax" key="commi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus gregatim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 192, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comminor: <entryFree id="n9380" type="main" key="commi^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n9380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to threaten one with something</hi>, esp., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to threaten with an attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to menace</hi> (in prose most freq. in the histt.; not in Cic.); constr. usu. <hi rend="ital">alicui aliquid;</hi> rarely <hi rend="ital">alicui aliquā re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comminando magis quam inferendo pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 39, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetum, Auct. B. Afr. 71: obsidionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 26, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">necem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui cuspide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:9:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 9, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:12:1:section=10 al" default="NO">1, 12, 1, § 10 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox comminantis audita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<mood>Part.</mood>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">commĭ-nātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">threatened</hi>: <pb n="379" /> <cb n="COMM" /> mots alicul, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 184, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novercae nex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 241, 16.</sense></entryFree>
comminuo: <entryFree id="n9381" type="main" key="commi^nu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĭnŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make small</hi>, either by breaking into many small parts, or by removing parts from the whole (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n9381.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To separate into small parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crumble to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to crush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">split</hi>, etc.: saxo cere comminuit brum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 412</bibl> (Ann. v. 586 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">fores et postes securibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa atque artua illo scipione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi statuam... deturbant, affligunt, comminuunt, dissipant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:38:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 38, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:25:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 25, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:73" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabas molis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med.
