Fac. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa crystallina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 64</bibl></cit>.—Also of medicines: <cit><quote lang="la">calculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 4, 13, § 23</bibl></cit>.—Fig.: diem articulatim, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to divide into hours</hi>, Plaut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9381.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lessen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9381.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): argenti pondus et auri, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:37:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 37, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 62, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9381.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to persons: <cit><quote lang="la">re familiari comminuti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9381.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (freq.), <hi rend="ital">to weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enervate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum esse officium tam sanctum atque solenne, quod non avaritia comminuere atque violare soleat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9381.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to persons: <cit><quote lang="la">Viriathus, quem C. Laelius praetor fregit et comminuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of enemies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:28" default="NO">2, 6, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec te natalis origo Comminuit (i. e. animum tuum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 472</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis comminuēre meis, i.e. vinceris, commoveberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 134</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
comminus: <entryFree id="n9382" type="main" key="commi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĭnus</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōmĭ-nus</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>manus; cf. Beda, Orth. p. 2331 P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Diff. p. 2193" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Diff. p. 2193</bibl> ib.</etym>; orig. belonging to milit. lang., of conflict, <sense id="n9382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in close contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hand to hand</hi> (with the sword, etc.), Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sustado/n</foreign>; opp. eminus, also to missilia, sagittae, etc. (class.; most freq. in the histt.): quae mea comminus machaera atque hasta hostibit e manu, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=270:29" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 270, 29</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec eminus hastis aut comminus gladiis uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique ex insidiis barbari a fronte ab tergo coörti comminus eminus petunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 34, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24:15" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 24, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 164, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ictu comminus neque conjectione telorum (pulsi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacula inutilia esse ... gladio comminus geri rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 35, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum locus comminus pugnandi daretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterani... comminus acriter instare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferre signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferre vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:47:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 47, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus resistentes niti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trucidato hostium duce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9382.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of copulation, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1051" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1051</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of fighting,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:213" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 213</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 122, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9382.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec fuerit nobis tamquam levis armaturae prima orationis excursio: nunc comminus agamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me epistulā petivit, ad te, ut video, comminus accessit,</quote> <trans><tr>has approached you in person</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in apros ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:176" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 176</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">agrestes comminus ire sues (for in sues),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 19, 22; <cit><quote lang="la">and so also of game: cervos obtruncant ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 374</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of the preparation of the soil (considered as a contest with the same): jacto qui semine comminus arva Insequitur, i. e. manu sive rastro urget, exercet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 104</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 16</bibl>; Hand, Turs. II. p. 96.—</sense><sense id="n9382.3" n="II" level="1"> In gen., without the access. idea of contest, <hi rend="ital">nigh at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>, = prope, in or ex propinquo (not freq. before the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">prius Eminus ardescunt quam comminus imbuat ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:904" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 904</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspicit hirsutos comminus ursa Getas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:74" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viso comminus armatorum agmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sole per eos dies comminus facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 55</bibl></cit>: aliquid comminus judicantur, <hi rend="ital">near at hand</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">by the eyesight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 42, 97, § 240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:17" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 3, 6, § 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recipere a debitore suo pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9382.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>, = statim, sine intermissione; a very common provincialism in Cisalpine Gaul, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9382.5" n="III" level="1"> In postAug. poetry sometimes = ad manus, <hi rend="ital">at hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comminus arma habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:583" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 583</bibl></cit>. <cb n="COMM" /></sense></entryFree>
comminutus: <entryFree id="n9383" type="main" key="commi^nu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commĭnūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from comminuo.</entryFree>
commis: <entryFree id="n9384" type="main" key="commis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. gummi.</entryFree>
commisceo: <entryFree id="n9385" type="main" key="commisce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-miscĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">con-m-</orth>), <itype>miscui, mixtum, or mistum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mix</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mingle together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to intermingle</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n9385.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, with <case>abl.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9385.2" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea amurcam cum aquā commisceto aequas partis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus... se cum eo commiscuit igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem illum sempiternum (Vestae) cum totius urbis incendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:57:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 57, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos cum ingenuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9385.3" n="B" level="2"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes capro commixta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commixta. vis venti calore, Lucr 6, 322: liquidum corpus turbantibus aëris auris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frusta cruento commixta mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 633</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commixtis igne tenebris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether... magno commixtus corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chio nota si commixta Falerni est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commixtae salivae melle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquias Phyllidis cineribus Juliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crocum aquā pluviali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 265" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 265</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9385.4" n="C" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se omnia pariter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 96, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse est ventus et aër Et calor inter se vigeant commixta per artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumus in auras Commixtus tenuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 500</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9385.5" n="D" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">commisce mulsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac (patinā) scarorum jocinera, phasianarum cerebella... commiscuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl></cit>.—Esp., in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mingled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compounded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos omnis commixto corpore dicent Esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:861" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 861</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fert commixtam ad astra favillam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 76</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commixti corpore tantum Subsident Teucri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 835</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of sexual union: <cit><quote lang="la">commiscendorum corporum libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 128</bibl></cit>: commisceri, Jul. Epit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:107:section=373" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> 107, § 373</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9385.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to unite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mingle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego abeo a te, ne quid tecum consili conmisceam, Plaut Mil. 2, 5, 68: siquis cum eo (Neptuno) quid rei conmiscuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:Rud. 2:6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus accusatoris cum jure testimonii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 35, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam temeritas cum sapientiā comm iscetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitu commixta querella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attulit hunc illi caecis terroribus aura Commixtum clamorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrasque partis in computatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:1:section=14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 1, § 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9385.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To produce by mingling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italo commixtus sanguine Silvius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of an Italian mother</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 762</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiae ex utroque commixtae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commiscibilis: <entryFree id="n9386" type="hapax" key="commisci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commiscĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>commisceo</etym>, <sense id="n9386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be mingled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commiscuus: <entryFree id="n9387" type="gloss" key="commiscu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commiscŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">koino/s</foreign>, Gloss Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
commiseratio: <entryFree id="n9388" type="main" key="commi^se^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commĭsĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>commiseror</etym>; <sense id="n9388.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in rhetoric,</quote> <trans><tr>a part of an oration intended to excite compassion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 58, 219</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:107" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 107</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 31, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commiseresco: <entryFree id="n9389" type="main" key="commi^se^resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĭsĕresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n9389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to commiserate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have sympathy with</hi> (anteclass.): servos, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 472, 29</bibl> (Trag. v. 222 Vahl.): Priamus si adesset, ipse ejus commiseresceret, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 11, 259</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 391 Rib.): ut illius conmiserescas miserulae orbitudinis, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 146, 18</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 211 ib.).—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">gen. rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchidem ejus commiseresceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commiseretur: <entryFree id="n9390" type="main" key="commi^se^re_tur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĭsĕrētur</orth>, <itype>ĭtum est, ēri, 2</itype>, <sense id="n9390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">gen. rei</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thou</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">have compassion upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compassionate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commiserate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navitas precum Arionis commiseritum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:19:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 19, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commisero: <entryFree id="n9391" type="main" key="commi^se^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĭsĕro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>miser</etym>, <sense id="n9391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a companion in misfortune</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 9</bibl>, as transl. of Gr. <foreign lang="greek">suntalai/pwros</foreign>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commiseror: <entryFree id="n9392" type="main" key="commi^se^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mĭsĕror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n9392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. dep.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to commiserate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bewail</hi> (class. but rare); <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>: aliquem, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 445, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam Graeciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commiserandā re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4</bibl></cit>. 55, 69: <cit><quote lang="la">interitum fratris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n9392.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inan. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">leo gemitus edens et murmura dolorem cruciatumque vulneris commiserantia,</quote> <trans><tr>making it known by complaints</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9392.2" n="II" level="1"> In rhetoric, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, of an orator, <hi rend="ital">to excite compassion</hi> (cf. commiseratio): quid cum commiserari,<cb n="COMM" />  conqueri coeperit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 46</bibl>: cum commiserandum sit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commissatio: <entryFree id="n9393" type="main" key="commissa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commissātĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">commissātor</orth>, v. comiss-.</entryFree>
commissio: <entryFree id="n9394" type="main" key="commissi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>committo</etym>. <sense id="n9394.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to committo, I. B.) <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a setting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bringing together in contest;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">the beginning of a contest</hi> (in the public games, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">tecum ago, ut jam ab ipsā commissione ad me... persequare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:54:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 54, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9394.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a speech at the opening of the games;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a prize declamation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ostentatious speech</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)gw/nisma</foreign>, Calig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl>; v. Casaub. in h. ll.—</sense><sense id="n9394.2" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to committo, II. B. 4.) <hi rend="ital">A perpetration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commission</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piaculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 148</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commissor: <entryFree id="n9395" type="main" key="commissor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commissor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>committo, II. B. 4.</etym>, <sense id="n9395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a perpetrator</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commissorius: <entryFree id="n9396" type="main" key="commisso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commissōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>committo</etym>; Lex, in jurid. lang., <sense id="n9396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clause in the condition of a sale</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of a contract</hi> (by which a vendor reserved to himself the privilege of rescinding the sale if the purchaser did not pay his purchase-money at the time agreed on), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:3:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 3, 14</bibl>.—So also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">com-missōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:3:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:23:11" default="NO">43, 23, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commissum: <entryFree id="n9397" type="main" key="commissum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commissum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. committo <sense id="n9397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
commissura: <entryFree id="n9398" type="main" key="commissu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commissūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>committo</etym>. <sense id="n9398.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a joining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">connecting together;</hi> hence, in concr., <hi rend="ital">a band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">juncture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commissure</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">commissura funis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nodorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molles digitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabiles ossium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nucum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 10, 11, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a mingling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 5, 11, § 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Piscium,</quote> <trans><tr>the knot in the constellation Pisces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:17:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 26:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 26, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9398.1" n="II" level="1"> In Quint. transf., <hi rend="ital">connection in discourse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:16:9:4:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 16, 9, 4, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
commissuralis: <entryFree id="n9399" type="main" key="commissu_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commissūrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>commissura</etym>, <sense id="n9399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a juncture</hi> (only in Veg.): <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 3, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commissus: <entryFree id="n9400" type="main" key="commissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from committo.</entryFree>
commistim: <entryFree id="n9401" type="hapax" key="commistim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commistim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">commixtim</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>commisceo</etym>, <sense id="n9401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a mixed manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jointly</hi>; opp. separatim, Hier. praef. in Isa.</sense></entryFree>
commistus: <entryFree id="n9402" type="main" key="commistus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commistus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from commisceo.</entryFree>
commitigo: <entryFree id="n9403" type="hapax" key="commi_ti^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mītĭgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">con-m-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n9403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make soft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mellow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui sandalio caput, humorously for contundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 4</bibl></cit> (imitated: misero mihi mitigabat sandalio caput, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 343, 15</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: mitis sum fustibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 1, 31</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
committo: <entryFree id="n9404" type="main" key="committo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">com-mitto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">con-m-</orth>), <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n9404.0" n="I" level="1"> Of two or more objects, <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combine into one whole; to join</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to connect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unite.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9404.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare; not in Cic.), constr. <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cum aliquā re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, and with <case>acc.</case> only. </sense><sense id="n9404.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res in ordinem digestae atque inter se commissae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: per nondum commissa inter se munimenta urbem intravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. thus with <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oras vulneris suturis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">easdem litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo comparativa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">costae committuntur cum osse pectoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam a Placentiā ut Flaminiae committeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā naris fronti committitur,</quote> <trans><tr>is joined to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā vir equo commissus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:478" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 478</bibl></cit> (of a Centaur); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of Scylla: delphinum caudas utero commissa luporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissa dextera dextrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medulla spinae commissa cerebro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles, quae urbem continenti committeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl> Duker.—</sense><sense id="n9404.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissa in unum crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 580</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">committuntur suturae in unguem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <case>acc.</case> only: barbaricam pestem navibus obtulit, commissam infabre, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 40, 31</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 271 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">commissis operibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidibusque mei commissa mariti moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(terra) maria committeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:14" default="NO">7, 7, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes duas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 13, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: nocte commissā. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1698" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1698</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissa corpore toto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 369</bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 248, 25</bibl>: cervix committitur primo<pb n="380" /> <cb n="COMM" />  artu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:310" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 310</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus plumbo commissa,</quote> <trans><tr>patched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:310" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 310</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring men</hi> or <hi rend="ital">animals together in a contest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as competitors</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to set together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set on</hi> (freq. in Suet.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere rare): pugiles Latinos cum Graecis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quingenis peditibus, elephantis vicenis, tricenis equitibus hinc et inde commissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">camelorum quadrigas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victores committe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:43:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 43, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 28:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spect. 28, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet Aenean Rutulumque ferocem Committas,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>you describe their contest in your poem</tr>, <tr>you bring them in contact with each other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:162" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eunucho Bromium committere noli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:378" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequales inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring together for comparison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to compare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">match</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">committit vates et comparat, inde Maronem, Atque aliā parte in trutinā suspendit Homerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:436" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 436</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:24:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 24, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a battle, war: proelium, certamen, bellum, etc. </sense><sense id="n9404.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To arrange a battle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enter upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelii committendi signum dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum proelium commissum audissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commisso ab equitibus proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aciem exercitum eduxit proeliumque commisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Milt. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:22" default="NO">15, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:6:6" default="NO">22, 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam eo ventum est, ut a ferentariis proelium committi posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commisso proelio, diutius nostrorum militum impetum hostes ferre non potuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6</bibl> Kraner ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar cohortatus suos proelium commisit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum proelium committi ex usu esset, necne,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 50</bibl></cit>; 1, 52; 2, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pridie quam Siciliensem pugnam classe committeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:96" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avidus committere pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:619" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:143" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rixae committendae causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vates monere eum (regem) coepit, ne committeret, aut certe differret obsidionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 27</bibl></cit>.—Of a drinking contest for a wager: <cit><quote lang="la">a summo septenis cyathis committe hos ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum commisso spectaculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musicum agona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:46" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissum (bellum) ac profligatum conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 40, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 25, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:28:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 28, 1 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis trium temporum momenta consideret, primo commissum bellum, profligatum secundo, tertio vero confectum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:15:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">committere Martem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:155" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo die ludi committebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos dedicationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 113</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.10" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to maintain a contest</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to fight a battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrate games</hi>, etc. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">illam pugnam navalem... mediocri certamine commissam arbitraris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levia inde proelia per quatriduum commissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 37, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commisso modico certamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 44, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">contra quem Sulla iterum commisit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam committeretur,</quote> <trans><tr>before the contest began</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.12" n="3" level="3"> In gen.: committere aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to begin any course of action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to undertake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni sanguine commissa proscriptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:64" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium inter sicarios committitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 11</bibl></cit>. —In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregie ad ultimum in audacter commisso perseveravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 8; 44, 6, 14.—</sense><sense id="n9404.13" n="4" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to practise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perpetrate wrong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">do injustice; to commit a crime</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n9404.14" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque timeant, qui nihil commiserint, et poenam semper ante oculos versari putent, qui peccaverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 23, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commississe cavet quod mox mutare laboret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego etiam quae tu sine Verre commisisti, Verri crimini daturus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum flagitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:61:219" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 61, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virilis audaciae facinora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majus delictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil nefandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 626</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefarias res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:9:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 9, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulterium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:1" default="NO">7, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incestum cum filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:12" default="NO">10, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:3" default="NO">5, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrilegium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="COMM" /> 28, 31.—<hi rend="ital">Aliquid adversus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erga</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">committere multa et in deos et in homines impie nefarieque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid adversus populum Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 38, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid erga te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.15" n="(b)" level="5"> Committere contra legem, in legem, lege, <hi rend="ital">to offend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commit an offence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi committeret contra legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 12, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in legem Juliam de adulteriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:13" default="NO">48, 10, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:3:8:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 34, 3, 8, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne lege censoriā committant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege de sicariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9404.16" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc si in posterum edixisses, minus esset nefarium... nemo enim committeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:43:section=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 43, § 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.17" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be guilty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be in fault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give occasion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to act so as that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id me commissurum ut patiar fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non committet hodie iterum ut vapulet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego nolo quemquam civem committere, ut morte multandus sit: tu, etiam si commiserit, conservandum putas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">committere ut accusator nominere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 14, 50</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non committam, ut tibi ipse insanire videar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:57:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 57, 233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 6</bibl>; Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 20, 1</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:27" default="NO">5, 13, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 37</bibl>.—More rare in a like sense, (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">cur</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caedicius negare se commissurum, cur sibi quisquam imperium finiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque commissum a se, quare timeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non committunt scamna facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelix committit saepe repelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 632</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.18" n="b" level="4"> Poenam, multam, etc., jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to bring punishment upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self by an error</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to incur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self liable to it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:12:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 20</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">committere in poenam edicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illam multam non commiserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 37, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 6</bibl> pr.—</sense><sense id="n9404.19" n="(b)" level="5"> Committi, with a definite object, <hi rend="ital">to be forfeited</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confiscated</hi>, as a penalty: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas Veneri Erycinae commissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 14, § 36</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">commissae hypothecae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 56, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissa tibi fiducia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 21, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:11:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 11, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:14:6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 39, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia in publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:12" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc devotionem capitis esse commissam,</quote> <trans><tr>incurred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:57:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 57, 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.20" n="c" level="4"> Also (mostly in jurid. Lat.) of laws, judicial regulations, promises, etc., that become binding in consequence of the fulfilment of a condition as the commission of a crime, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in civitatem obligatam sponsione commissa iratis omnibus diis,</quote> <trans><tr>a promise the condition of which has been fulfilled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11, 10</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc ego devotionem capitis mei... convictam esse et commissam putabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:57:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 57, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si alius committat edictum,</quote> <trans><tr>transgresses</tr>, <tr>incurs its penalty</tr>, <tr>makes himself liable to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:4:3:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 4, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commisso edicto ab alio filio, ib. lex 8, § 4: commisso per alium edicto, ib. lex 10, § 1 al.: statim atque commissa lex est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:3:4:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 18, 3, 4, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">committetur stipulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:56" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 24, 3, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n9404.21" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To place a thing</hi> somewhere for preservation, protection, care, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commit to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resign to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to trust</hi> (syn.: commendo, trado, credo; very freq. and class.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi> (<hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>) <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9404.22" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid</hi> (<hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">se</hi>) <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honor non solum datus sed etiam creditus ac commissus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 14, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec illi (Catoni) committendum illud negotium, sed inponendum putaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:28:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui capita vestra non dubitatis credere, cui calceandos nemo commisit pedes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 14, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me tuae commendo et committo fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 47</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 5, 61</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid committam tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 5, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">his salutem nostram, his fortunas, his liberos rectissime committi arbitramur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 9, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">4: tibi rem magnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:25:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 25, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia commissi sunt eis magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 25, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum imperium potestatemque omnium rerum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domino rem omnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput tonsori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratem pelago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcis semina (corresp. with spem credere terrae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 223</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">committere semen sitienti solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, <cb n="COMM" /> 8, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcus frigori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18</bibl></cit>, n. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">verba tabellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 587</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivunt commissi calores Aeoliae fidibus puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 11 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">committere se populo, senatui, publicis praesidiis et armis (corresp. with se tradere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 23, 61</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se theatro populoque Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:54:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 54, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:59:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 59, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 32, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se publico,</quote> <trans><tr>to venture into the streets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se neque navigationi, neque viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 11, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se timidius fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilibus fluctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:6:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 6, 1 al.</bibl></cit>—Prov.: ovem lupo (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">katalei/pein o)/i+n e)n lu/koisi</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.23" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid</hi> (<hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">se</hi>) <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi> (so esp. freq. in Liv.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in alicujus fidem committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 14, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in id conclave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 23, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in conspectum populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 11, § 26</bibl></cit>; cf. Pompei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, C, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">se in senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 21, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summae fuisse dementiae dubiā spe impulsum certum in periculum se committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in casum ancipitis eventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 27, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">duos filios in aleam ejus casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se in aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 26, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 11, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">rempublicam in discrimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 32, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum summam in discrimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 7, 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9404.24" n="(g)" level="5"> Simply <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>, or entirely <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanan' es, Quae isti committas?</quote> <trans><tr>in trusting to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei commisi et credidi, Ter, Heaut. 5, 2, 13: haec cum scirem et cogitarem, commisi tamen, judices, Heio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:7:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 7, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universo populo neque ipse committit neque illi horum consiliorum auctores committi recte putant posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti, quibus necessario committendum existimabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quoniam non es veritus concredere nobis, accipe commissae munera laetitiae,</quote> <trans><tr>intrusted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:10:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instant enim (adversarii) et saepe discrimen omne committunt, quod deesse nobis putant,</quote> <trans><tr>often hazard the most important advantage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum senatus ei commiserit, ut videret, ne quid res publica detrimenti caperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 26, 70</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste negat se de existimatione suā cuiquam nisi suis commissurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:60:section=137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 60, § 137</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">commissum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n9404.25" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I. 3.) <hi rend="ital">An undertaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enterprise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aliud restabat quam audacter commissum corrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supererat nihil aliud in temere commisso, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.26" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. 4.) <hi rend="ital">A transgression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi aut quid commissi aut est causa jurgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquod hujus factum aut commissum non dicam audacius, sed quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 26, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">turpe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissi praemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:590" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 590</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">post mihi non simili poenā commissa luetis,</quote> <trans><tr>offences</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 136</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fateri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:5" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 304</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.27" n="2" level="3"> Jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">an incurring of fines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a confiscation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confiscated property</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commissum cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa commissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16 al" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 39, 4, 16 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:61" default="NO">19, 2, 61</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid pro commisso tenetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 341" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 341</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9404.28" n="C" level="2"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">That which is intrusted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">enuntiare commissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:13:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissa celare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:93" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissa tacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinent commissa fideliter aures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissum teges (corresp. with arcanum scrutaberis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 200</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commixtim: <entryFree id="n9405" type="main" key="commixtim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commixtim</orth>, v. commistim.</entryFree>
commixtio: <entryFree id="n9406" type="main" key="commixti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commixtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-mist-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>commisceo</etym>, <sense id="n9406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mixing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mingling</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl>; cf. Vet. Gloss.: commixtio <foreign lang="greek">xu/ma</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
commixtum: <entryFree id="n9407" type="main" key="commixtum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commixtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. commisceo <sense id="n9407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
commixtura: <entryFree id="n9408" type="main" key="commixtu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commixtūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-mist-</orth>), ae. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>commisceo</etym>, <sense id="n9408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mixing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mingling</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 1</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
commixtus: <entryFree id="n9409" type="main" key="commixtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commixtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from commisceo.</entryFree>
commobilis: <entryFree id="n9410" type="hapax" key="commo_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commōbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>commoveo</etym>, <sense id="n9410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily moving</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:9:48" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 9, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
commodatio: <entryFree id="n9411" type="hapax" key="commo^da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">commŏdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. commodo</etym>, <sense id="n9411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rendering of service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accommodation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alternae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 81, 16</bibl></cit>. <pb n="381" /> <cb n="COMM" /></sense></entryFree>
